story:
I am a trans-identified singer, performance artist and a costume designer. Instead of transforming my physical body from a male to female, I chose a spiritual practice, and also art practice, as a tool to be liberated from personal and social conflicts around gender and identity. In my life, duality of gender was a big struggle but then it became a big ingredient in my art. I want to share my story with you.

Like the reggae song says, ‘Promised Land is a state of mind’.​  “DoYou: Migration of Monarch” is about a journey to a Promised Land.

 It means one's higher self or true fulfillment in Life. The seasonal migration of Monarch butterflies in nature inspires me to reflect on my personal journey, migrating from South Korea (where I was considered mentally ill for being who I was), to Los Angeles to find my voice and freedom as a trans-identified artist. It is a story about the realization of my power dynamics through a transformation of identity, and how it can evoke the same shift in others and society.

"DoYou: Migration of The Monarchs" is a Victorian Kabuki Burlesque spectacle of sexually charged transcendence, to reunite the sacred feminine and the sacred masculine. I was selected to present it as part of Los Angeles One City One Pride Arts Festival and Hollywood Fringe Festival in June. I am very honored to receive a grant from the City of West Hollywood and a scholarship from the Hollywood Fringe to cover the basics of the show but I need your help to raise money to produce a professional show to make my vision come true. A big part of the money will go into production costs such as: costume, lighting, sets, sound, and publicity. Equally important is to be able to collaborate with other amazing artists on essential elements of DoYou such as choreography and music. Your funding will help make this collective effort possible and give us a good foundation to take "Migration of the Monarchs" further.

 

Breakdown cost of each part : 

1. One City One Pride Interactive Performance Installation : $2200 

2. One City One Pride Live Ambient Art ( WALK ) : $4250

3. Hollywood Fringe Theater Production : $18.111

The major costs of "Do You: Migration of The Monarchs" are:

Costume = $5718

Performers/Assistants = $5287

Composer, Choreographer, Producer, and other creative/production artists and designers = $5325

Technical crew = $4300

The total cost, not including costs covered by One City One Pride grant and Hollywood Fringe scholarship funds is $24,561      *any extra funds will be used to make a music video of "Migration of the Monarchs."

“Do You” is the self-empowerment mantra I want to share with you.

It means *Doing You* : Self-Actualization. DoYou is about connection after separation.

We all are the stars in our DoYou show! Please support me or share this message to bring power back to our Selves by using art as a tool.

Let's celebrate our universal transformation!!

For your generous participation in this journey you will receive:

Big part of my perks are focused on the connection between the artist and the audience ( funder ).  I create most of my costumes and props and objects that has special personal meaning for myself and the act.  I'd like to share part of myself with you through this connecting objects. Be a part of DoYou show by owning the costumes (hand-made wearable arts) and artifacts (hand-made props and objects) as perks . By doing so, you become the part of creations and the star of DoYou show. *Win Win is a business exchange aesthetic of DoYou , FYI. **Heart+Hand made by me or my team, each comes with special DoYou message. ***Sustainability Fashion

Perk Swallowtail @ $33 : a ticket to the show and your name printed on a playbill

Perk  Duke of Burgundy @ $111 :  hand made collector's item yozmit mask, each comes with special *DoYou* Mantra. made from the same fabric from the costumes from the show.

Perk Adonis Blue @ $555 : Yozmit's wearable art medicine object Onesie called Journey Suit. Made from the same fabric from the show costumes. 

and also some artifacts/props and costumes used during this *DoYou* ritual  from the show will be another perks for you to own part of this show.

 

Visual Performance World of Yozmit *

 

Yozmit WALK performance ( Live Ambient Art ) around the globe **

About Yozmit

Yozmit is a Los Angeles based singer song writer, performance theater artist and costume designer. Through the ritualistic performance art, Yozmit combines theater, dance, pop culture, fashion, gender identity, mythology and shamanism onto a single canvas. She sees her art as a form of research that helps define the unknown mysteries of her universe. Yozmit has been an international headliner at The Box, NYC and London and also has performed at The Museum of Modern Art for Marina Abramovic.

Links

Yozmit Website :   http://www.yozmit.com

Yozmit HBO segment  : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w2yB7GnY52E

Yozmit Artist Profile : https://vimeo.com/136573303

Yozmit Walk Performance : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7WLALHoJT7Q

What is DoYou? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RZnFE67dI4c&t=7s: 

Yozmit Hollywood Fringe Festival : https://www.yozmit.com/dymm

story:
Who Are Warm Women?

Hello Dear Ones Near and Far!

My name is Susannah Simpson, and I am the creator and director of "Warm Women," a performance piece investigating the breadth and depth of female sexuality and the innumerable states of being and possibilities that lay therein. It was developed in collaboration with the performers, Helen Gutowski, Laura Ornella, Rebekah Nagy, and Madeline Sachs, who bravely, boldly, tenderly shared their worries, wonders, woes, and wishes, which was integral to the formation of the piece. 

For me, "Warm Women" is a culmination of many years of making solo and group choreography and performance art, and an intersection with the work I do teaching yoga and leading women's workshops that focus on female healing and empowerment through connecting to our bodies and sensuality. I am so proud of this creation and cannot wait to share its riches and watch it grow! 

After premiering "Warm Women" at Bushwick Open Studios (a Brooklyn based arts festival) last Spring, to a very enthusiastic response, we began to discuss its future, and how we could most efficiently and expansively share the work and its message. It became clear that taking it on a US tour would be a radical next step in its evolution and continuing the process of Warming our society.


Why We Need Your Warmth!


As you know, drivers, commuters, jet-setters, and cross-country enthusiasts, traveling is expensive! Gasoline is expensive! Feeding and lodging five women as they traverse the United States of America is no teeny feat. 

We want to take the piece to as many places and parts of the country as possible, but will need a vessel to carry us, fuel for our bodies and said chariot, funding for our technical needs, sleeping arrangements and everything in between. The five of us will be leaving our homes and jobs in New York for an ENTIRE month because we believe in the importance of sharing this work SO MUCH! 

In March 2016, we plan on driving down the Eastern seaboard, performing "Warm Women" from our home in Brooklyn all the way down to Atlanta, and then veering westward through Louisiana, Texas, Arizona, and finally to California, and up the West coast as far as Seattle . We also hope to weave our constellation Chicago, Boston, Washington D.C. and many precious portals in between. As you can see, this is a grand adventure we are setting out to undertake, and $15,000, ripe a sum as it may be, is the minimum amount of economic support with which we can execute this mission. Every single cent you offer will go to realizing this tour, and our dreams of sharing its remedies with the rest of our country.


Why Our Country Needs Warmth! 


We believe that as human beings raised in a patriarchal, sexually repressive culture, there is a tremendous amount of unlearning required in order to actually connect, in a shame-free way, with our own bodies, needs, and desires. This applies to all genders and orientations, as we have all received a mountain of messages from the media, our families, our hometowns, and our lineages regarding what it means to be sexy, sexual, desirable, healthy, and "normal". Because of this, we must carefully identify and remove the hooks and blocks that keep us from knowing and celebrating ourselves and each other. 

Warm Women serves as a window into the female sexual experience, in no way covering the myriad bases, but representing potent moments along the spectrum. Our goal is to help people feel connected, supported, comforted, and encouraged to listen to and honor themselves, their bodies, and each other, and to remember that “sexy” is not an image, a product, or idea that can be bought or sold, but rather, something that comes from listening to and following our own sensations and needs. Sexy is what feels good.


There is so much shame in our culture, which becomes both internalized and externalized collectively and individually. We wish to aid in the cleansing process of this buildup which keeps us from learning and enjoying our full potential as creatures on this Earth. We believe that in starting with something as innate and ubiquitous as sexuality, we can contribute to the holistic cleansing of our society, with the goal of creating a more open, compassionate, and conscious culture for ourselves and future generations.


Warm Perks


Please check out all of the dreamy, nurturing rewards offered in our perks section. We would love to bestow you with these goodies! Anything you are able to contribute will be felt through us and all who witness the piece, fully and dearly. If you are unable to make a financial donation at the moment, you can help spread the warmth by passing along this link to friends, co-workers, siblings, loves, local politicians, you get the skinny! We love you greatly and consider you all fellow Warm Women. Let's make it feel better together!

story:
Hello, my name is Madelyn, I am an artist in the United States and this is my first ever art book featuring a collection of finished work and concept art from the past several years!

This will be a signed 80 page 8.5x11 hardcover Artbook with high resolution images on 80lb gloss stock paper.

Throughout the years I have studied different subject matters, mediums and techniques to really find the best way to use art. Like many other artists, I use art to express myself as well as tell a story. Sometimes, that story isn't always mine, so I develop characters and scenery to capture someone else's feelings.

 

 

I know a lot of you have found me through my social media links and I want to tell you thank you so  much for all the support and encouragement you have shown!

 

Stretch Goal #1- Fully Funded STICKER PACK

Upon being fully funded, all physical rewards will come with these 3 vinyl waterproof stickers!

 

 

Stretch Goal #2-$5,000 MORE PAGES

Once we reach $5,000 in funds, I will add in extra 10 pages!

 

Stretch Goal #3- $7,000 Printed Artist Trading Cards

Once we reach $7,000 in funds I will add in a 6 pack of printed and signed artist trading cards

 

Stretch Goal #4- $10,000 Dust Jacket and Stamped Book

Once we Reach $10,000 all books will have a dust jacket included and a special stamp of authenticity inside the cover

story:
What is the First Anguilla Sculpture Symposium?

The first event of its kind in the Caribbean, the First Anguilla Sculpture Symposium is a dynamic, LIVE public event in which, over a 3-week period, 3 internationally renowned artists will create 3 original sculptures celebrating Anguilla’s history and culture.


When & Where?

The Symposium will take place at the beautiful Art Café in historic Island Harbour, Anguilla, from November 9 through November 27, 2015. 

What are we all about and what impact will this event have?

For us, it’s all about creating a legacy of art and education for the beloved place we call home—Anguilla.

  • Free and open to the public, the Symposium is a unique opportunity for residents and visitors alike to watch the artists hard at work, to speak with them, and to learn first hand about what actually goes into the creation of a public sculpture. Locals, tourists, Anguillian youth, and the sculptors will together experience the joy that comes from liberating a work of art from a block of stone or a hunk of metal.

  • To engage and ignite the latent creativity of the Island’s youth, school groups will come from all over the island to visit the worksite.  While there, the participating artists will lead a series of innovative sculpture workshops for the students—sharing their skills, knowledge and love of the art form.

  • To offer those students with the nascent skills and maturity, especially at risk youth, the opportunity to uncover their talents, there is the possibility of hands-on participation in the creative work.

  • The public sculptures that the artists create will remain on permanent display on Anguilla, and it’s our hope that they will constitute the first steps in what will in time become Anguilla’s Sculpture Trail.

  • As an international event, the Symposium fosters cultural exchange and cooperation between the participating artists, who are joining us from various parts of the globe, and Anguilla’s thriving arts and crafts community.


Who’s on the team and how did this all get started?


The beginning…

Last year, in London, our Director, Walter Bayer, attended a talk at the Royal British Society of Sculptors on public art. Utterly inspired by what he’d heard, it was here that he met artist Alexandra Harley, MRBS, who asked him that fateful question, “Have you ever thought of organizing a sculpture symposium in Anguilla?”

A little history…

From Alex, Walter learned that sculpture symposia take place all over the world, from Russia to Australia to Germany. The International Sculpture Symposium movement originated in Austria in 1959 when sculptor Karl Prantl created an event in an abandoned stone quarry in a bid to provide networking opportunities for artists working in 3D. From then on sculptors have been helping each other to initiate new symposia worldwide. For each symposium, artists come together to work on their own pieces, to share their skills and knowledge with each other in an environment of support and cooperation, and to create works for the community to enjoy for generations.


Introducing the team…

The more Walter thought about it, the more he liked the idea and all the exciting educational and artistic possibilities it entailed for the island. The Symposium soon became a family project as Walter enlisted the help of his two daughters, Helen and Teresa, and his good friends, Penny and Hendrick. Together this mad cap team have recruited a trusted team of advisors and experts, including Anguillian artists Courtney Devonish and Cheddie Richardson; Joan Richardson, Anguilla Tourist Board; and Janine Edwards, marketing expert and owner of Sunset Homes.

Which artists will be taking part in the Symposium?

The most important members of our team are, of course, the artists who will be working hard to produce fantastic, original works for Anguilla.


Jon Barlow Hudson

http://www.hudsonsculpture.com

Jon Barlow Hudson creates public sculpture, private sculpture installations and corporate sculpture environments world-wide. His influences range from molecular structures to Zen Buddhism. Jon Barlow Hudson received his MFA from the California Institute of the Arts and has exhibited extensively across the US, UK, Europe, China and Japan. An internationally renowned artist, he has installed public sculpture projects in 23 countries around the world.


Almuth Tebbenhoff

http://www.tebbenhoff.org

Born in Fürstenau in North West Germany, Tebbenhoff came to England and studied Ceramics at the Sir John Cass School of Art. She lives and works in London. Inspired by process, Tebbenhoff is fascinated by the way objects of beauty and intrigue can emerge from industrial processes like cutting and welding steel. Constantly seeking to balance opposing forces and create new harmonies, she finds inspiration in the natural world and in astronomical space. She has exhibited widely across the UK and Europe and her work is included in a variety of collections, including the Library of Leicester University, the Cass Sculpture Foundation and the Goodwood Estate.


Alexandra Harley

http://www.alexandraharley.co.uk

Alexandra Harley’s dynamic sculptures capture and conjure a sense of movement and animation in non-kinetic sculpture. Working predominantly in wood and stone, Harley produces lively and robust carved constructions with a rich variety of textures. Based in London, Alexandra Harley studied at Central St. Martins and Wimbledon School of Art. She exhibits regularly internationally and has participated in numerous residencies and symposia across Europe and the US.


How will we use the funding?

As you may or may not know—putting together a sculpture symposium can be an expensive affair. We are working hard to solicit in-kind donations for all manner of supplies and services, from borrowing angle grinders and cranes to asking local restaurants to feed our lovely artists and enthusiastic team of volunteers.

Today, we’re asking for funds so that we can provide our participating artists with an honorarium to thank them for all their hard work and toil in the hot sun—and to help cover the cost of their flights to Anguilla. Aside from taking care of our artists, the money will go towards any supplies that we could not receive in-kind. If you or a friend would also like to make an in-kind donation of some sort, just get in touch with our Director at anguillasculpturesymposium@gmail.com.


What are some other ways to help?

You can help us get the word out on social media, via facebook @AnguillaSculpture and twitter @AnguillaSculpt

And use the Indiegogo share tools!


Want to attend the Symposium?

We are in the process of putting together hotel packages for visitors to the Symposium, so send us an email at anguillasculpturesymposium@gmail.com and we will keep you posted re discounts on accommodation.

world-wide. His influences range from molecular structures to Zen Buddhism. Jon
Barlow Hudson received his MFA from the California Institute of the Arts and
has exhibited extensively across the US, UK, Europe, China and Japan. An
internationally renowned artist, he has installed public sculpture projects in
23 countries around the world.


Almuth Tebbenhoff
http://www.tebbenhoff.org

Born in Fürstenau in North West Germany, Tebbenhoff
came to England and studied Ceramics at the Sir John Cass School of Art. She
lives and works in London. Inspired by process, Tebbenhoff is fascinated by the
way objects of beauty and intrigue can emerge from industrial processes like
cutting and welding steel. Constantly seeking to balance opposing forces and
create new harmonies, she finds inspiration in the natural world and in
astronomical space. She has exhibited widely across the UK and Europe and her
work is included in a variety of collections, including the Library of
Leicester University, the Cass Sculpture Foundation and the Goodwood Estate.


Alexandra Harley
http://www.alexandraharley.co.uk



Alexandra Harley’s dynamic
sculptures capture and conjure a sense of movement and animation in non-kinetic
sculpture. Working predominantly in wood and stone, Harley produces lively and
robust carved constructions with a rich variety of textures. Based in London,
Alexandra Harley studied at Central St. Martins and Wimbledon School of Art.
She exhibits regularly internationally and has participated in numerous
residencies and symposia across Europe and the US.
How will we use the funding?


As you may or may not know—putting together a
sculpture symposium can be an expensive affair. We are working hard to solicit
in-kind donations for all manner of supplies and services, from borrowing angle
grinders and cranes to asking local restaurants to feed our lovely artists and enthusiastic
team of volunteers.

Today, we’re asking for funds so that we can provide our participating artists
with an honorarium to thank them for all their hard work and toil in the hot
sun—and to help cover the cost of their flights to Anguilla. Aside from taking
care of our artists, the money will go towards any supplies that we could not
receive in-kind. If you or a friend would also like to make an in-kind donation
of some sort, just get in touch with our Director at anguillasculpturesymposium@gmail.com.

What are some other ways to help?

You can help us get the word out
on social media, via facebook @AnguillaSculpture and twitter @AnguillaSculpt

And use the Indiegogo share tools!
Want to attend the Symposium?
We are in the process of putting together hotel packages for visitors to the Symposium, so send us an email at anguillasculpturesymposium@gmail.com and we will keep you posted re discounts on accommodation.

story:
About me:

I am a freelance illustrator from Portland, Maine who enjoys working with mixed mediums. I’m constantly building a portfolio of portraits, editorial work, and personal work. The personal work includes my sketchbooks, which are my absolute favorite thing to work on. 

The reason I love drawing in my sketchbooks is because it is the most therapeutic, or remedial, thing that I do in my studio practice; hence the name of the book. I’ve had tics caused by Tourette Syndrome since I was young. The tics are cyclical, and can get really severe and debilitating, especially when I feel anxious. To me, anxiety feels like there’s all kinds of pressure built up inside of me, and the tics are my body’s way of releasing the pressure. I have discovered that while I’m drawing, my tics subside. It’s as if the pressure is being released through my pen instead of my face, and it’s such a relief. For this reason I am constantly sketching, and have filled over 1,000 sketchbook pages in the last 12 months alone. 

“Remedial Sketches” is a book that is very personal because of how important sketching has become to me. I’ve spent the past few months compiling and organizing work from my sketchbooks to find my favorite pages. Because all of the drawings have meaning to me for one reason or another, it has been hard narrowing them down to what will be included in the book. 

I currently have a few different versions of the book ranging from 144 - 192 pages, and ultimately one of them will be the final product. This means that the book will be at least 144 pages, but possibly more depending on the success of the campaign. Because the book will be 100% complete while the campaign is still running, it will be sent to the printers the second this campaign wraps up, and the printer has agreed to print and rush-ship books for those who pre-order through this campaign. This means that by supporting the campaign you are guaranteeing that you will receive your books up to 8 weeks sooner than anyone else. By contributing to the campaign you are also helping me to publish this meaningful book, and I am very grateful to you for helping me make this a reality. Here’s a small taste of the book:

 

 

Goal and Timetable:

The reason my goal is set at $6,500 is because that is how much it costs to print and ship 1,000 hardcover copies. All of the funds raised through this campaign will go directly towards the cost of printing this 144+ page full color art book. The more copies I am able to order, the cheaper each individual book will cost. At 1,000 copies the per book cost goes down dramatically, which helps me keep the price of each individual book as low as possible.

As far as crowdfunding goes, this project is virtually risk-free for you, the backer, and here’s why: Although reaching my goal will help me print 1,000 copies of “Remedial Sketches”, I will print the number of copies I need to fulfill orders even if I don’t fully reach the goal. This means that if you help me fund this campaign, you can be confident that you will receive your perk even if the campaign is not fully funded. But please keep in mind that reaching the goal would be huge for this project, and whatever you can give to help will absolutely make a difference and will be greatly appreciated. 

This is also my second campaign. My first campaign was another successful book, and all of my backers received their perks in a timely fashion. I also sell my art on Etsy at https://www.etsy.com/shop/LewisRossignolArt and have a 5-Star review, which shows that I am determined to make sure everyone who supports my art with their hard earned money is satisfied with their purchase. In this campaign I am just as determined to make sure all of you are satisfied.

Because the art for the book is all done, and the book is fully laid out and edited, the only obstacle left is printing and shipping the books. As soon as this campaign reaches it's goal or comes to an end, whichever comes first, the book file will be sent to the printer. Once the books are printed they will be shipped to me, and I will be able to then ship them (and other perks) directly to all of you. The time in between the end of the campaign and when you receive your package in the mail will be as short as possible. Because I am not in full control of the printing I cannot give an exact shipping date, but I can say that the printer has agreed to rush ship the number of books I need to fulfill the pre-orders. I am also using a printer that I have used before, and based on my experience would not be surprised if you received your packages in September. I can guarantee that you will receive your books way before the holidays if that is something that concerns you.

Shipping Note: I am making this book available to anyone internationally. The shipping costs will vary depending on where you live.  

 

About the Perks:

I've varied the different levels of perks available so that anyone who is interested in helping can afford to do so. I am also incredibly thankful to anyone who shares this campaign with their friends and family via social media, email, or word of mouth. By pre-ordering your copy of “Remedial Sketches” at the $25 level you are saving 20% off of the post-campaign retail price, and your book will be signed and personalized.

I have included options for campaign backers to get discounted original drawings, original pages from my sketchbook, multiple books at a discounted rate, limited edition prints, notated books, and even the option to commission a piece of original art. So if there is something specific that you would like me to personally illustrate for you this is your opportunity to make that happen. I am also making 25 1-Of-A-Kind editions of this book with an original unique drawing done inside each of them. These 25 books will also be signed and numbered. If you have any questions about this campaign that isn't answered on this page please message me and I will get back to you as soon as I possibly can.

Note about PayPal: Indiegogo doesn't accept PayPal, however I do personally accept it so if you would like to order a perk or help out the campaign just email me at lrossignol@meca.edu and tell me which perk you would like and your mailing address and I will respond ASAP with my PayPal info and the total cost including shipping. Sorry for the extra step, but I really appreciate your support. 

lrossignol@meca.edu

http://www.instagram.com/lewisrossignol/

http://www.lewisrossignolart.com

https://www.etsy.com/shop/LewisRossignolArt

story:
First Night Missoula is a community wide celebration of the arts. Now in its 25th year, the festival spans roughly 30 venues across Missoula happening from noon to midnight on New Year’s Eve. With over 70 performances and activities each year, the festival is packed with artists, musicians, dancers and plenty of family friendly fun. We would love for the opportunity to keep this tradition alive.

First Night boasts over 70 events and activities all over Missoula on New Year’s Eve. We're excited to bring great new experiences such as a mobile foundry offering participants the opportunity create their own iron artwork, a Circus Club performing and teaching aerial stunts, Missoula's best musicians of every genre, nationally acclaimed comedians, and much more.

At Arts Missoula we have always focused on paying our First Night artists, for without them there would be no celebration.  In addition, there are the costs of technical assistance, venue rental, insurance, marketing, and providing food and beverage for over 200 volunteers. While many First Night celebrations across the country are shutting their doors, we're looking for your help to keep this community event alive. All donations are tax-deductible.

Every dollar counts at ARTS Missoula, serving our community at First Night Missoula and beyond. Thank you for your generosity!

story:
About Me

I am Watercolour artist living in Hamilton, Ontario and I moved here because I fell in love with the buildings. I have a dream of painting many of the buildings that strike me as so beautiful in the downtown Hamilton area and putting them in a self published coffee table book.

Some Hamiltonians have such a negative outlook of our beautiful city and can't get past the negative aspects that I'm sure they have only heard about because if they saw these beautiful buildings through my eyes they'd also see the beauty.

After roaming around, photographing and painting this city for 6 years I have made many friends in the downtown area including the homeless, street workers and buskers and many of them see and celebrate Hamilton's beauty as well. As a matter of fact I have never felt threatened or unwelcome here.

If the folks in the fringes see it then why do the many positions, business owners and successful people I have met, that should be proud of where they live, still continuously cut it down?

It's my belief that my little coffee table book will allow people outside of Hamilton to see its beauty BEFORE they are influenced by some of the folks who seem to take pride in sharing their negative attitudes.

I want to spend this summer....

Sketching, Drawing and Painting:

  • I will blog and write about my adventures for the book and share the paintings as created.

  • I will be having my paintings available at Mixed Media here in Hamilton for Purchase as well as on display at HomeGrown Hamilton.

  • If I don't reach my goal I will be very happy with whatever folks have helped me with. I'll just spend more time in my work as a freelance photographer to make ends meet and less time sitting in front of buildings with my sketch books.

Other Ways You Can Help

It is a lot to ask I know but if you can't afford to contribute financially you can help me reach my goal by:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.

  • Use Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

  • Send me a message with some words of encouragement

story:
Who I am

I am "The Rock'o"graph". I love music and musicians. My aim is to show the emotion on stage and I am not interested in "reporting" a concert. When I shoot, I feel as a part of the band and as part of the audience at the same time - my Nikon is my instrument.

My first concert photos I've taken around 1979. This means: photographed, designed and developed the negative myself. In the period until 1985 I shoot artists such as Rory Gallagher, Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry, The J. Geils Band, ZZ Top, Richie Blackmore.

A fire in my photo lab has destroyed all the negatives and prints. Only a handful of negatives survived. After this fire I wasn't able to handle a camera for 25 years.

With the beginning of 2014 I wanted to try it again and since the "Rock'o'graph" is back on tour.

What I am going to do

I will visit about 100 concerts this year. In spring 2015 I will show the best rock'o'graphic shots in an exhibition. Every picture I will present will be published in a limited edition of 10. The pics will be sized 60x90 or 90x90 cmon 3mm Alu Dibond.
Who has already been rock'o'graphed?

- Mothers Finest
- Ray Wilson
 - Robert Cray
- Patricia Vonne Band
- Blackberry Smoke
- Will Wilde
- Checkmate (with Ronnie Drayton, TC Tolliver & Wyzard)
- King King
- Loudboy
- Sharron Levy
- Mark Forster
- Roger McGuinn (The Byrds)
- Phil May (Pretty Things)
- Hamilton Loomis
- Arthur Brown
- Joyce Kennedy (Mothers Finest)
- Kenny Wayne Shepherd
- Jeff Beck
- Manfred Mann
- Rocky Athas
- Albert Lee
- John Mayall
- Wyzard (Mothers Finest)
- Kim Simmonds (Savoy Brown)
- Ray Wilson
- Dick Taylor (early Rolling Stones, Pretty Things)
- Ana Calvi
- Cassie Taylor
- Meena Cryle
- Chris Fillmore
- Hans Theessink
- Norman Beaker
- Larry Garner
- Paul Jones (The Blues Band)
- Christine Jones

Who's next?

- UB40, Dec. 08.


Why I need some money

I need to produce about 20 big sized printouts of my rock'o'graphic work, which will be the base of my exhibition. Every printout is aobout 150€.

What you get

I will publish a limited edition of 250 DIN A4 photos, showing one of my rock'o'graphic shots. There are some more perks to get. For are real big supporter and strong believer in my rock'o'graphic art I offer an unique Rock'o'graphy

How you can support me without spending money

visit my facebook-site "The Rock'o'graph" at https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Rockograph/663110010417073?ref=hl
Like it, tell your friends & share my pics.

Share my crowdfunding site on your social media platforms.

If you are connected to a gallery owner outside of germany, help me to get in contact with him. I want to show my work outside germany.

story:
In the heart of the Midwest, there is a vibrant community of individuals dedicated to the idea of creating a space to enact self-reliance, self-expression, respect of the environment, and the value of the common good. These good folk will gather at a transformational festival in October, and this work will serve as the central effigy art project for the community.

Our campaign will fund only the material costs of a large-scale burnable art installation for this festival taking place in October. The structure, Our Hive, is an abstract geometric representation of a beehive. The building allows for interaction in a variety of ways. Participants can admire the structure’s intrinsic aesthetic beauty, sit or cuddle in one of the numerous alcoves, lounge in the cargo net, or scale to the top to look around. The structure will be illuminated with LED lighting systems that bring the internal design and negative space into greater conscious awareness. It will stand at around 18 feet tall with a rough diameter of 20 feet at the base.

The festival organizers have already awarded our team a $500 grant for the structure. We need your help to make up the difference in cost for building materials. Our goal of $1,190 will cover the lumber costs for the project.


What We Need & What You Get

    All of the funds raised will pay for the cost of the materials to build and transport the structure to the festival site. This campaign to raise $1,190 will cover the cost of the lumber for the 18 foot by 20 foot effigy. Additional costs not covered by this campaign include $1,800 to cover all remaining construction and transportation needs (e.g. internal netting: $170, hardware: $125, lighting: $100, truck rental: $385, and burn costs) Fuel, tools and construction space have already been donated. If we do not meet our goal, all funds will still support the project, and we will have to work even harder to raise money in person…

    As a supporter of Our Hive, you'll receive our sincere gratitude, plus additional perks depending on the level of your contribution. These range from handwritten thank you notes to custom stickers to patches to the chance to light Our Hive on fire...in person!


    The Impact

      Our Hive will be the central art piece and effigy for a transformational festival in Ohio. Dozens of these events occur across the globe, and the movement is on the rise. With roots in the dreams of activists, artists, hippies and seekers, transformational festivals create radically free spaces where participants awaken to their inner selves and experience a new way of being that springs from self-expression and community interaction.

      Here in the Midwest, this “dreams made real” opportunity is rare. Opportunities to connect with like-minded folk who passionately believe in the values of radical inclusion, radical self-expression, leaving no trace, and the value of communal effort and civic responsibility are unusual. Burn festivals create the opportunity for individuals to propel the next evolution of humankind forward.


      The Artist

      In 2012, Thom Root attended his first burn festival. An unassuming software engineer in his regular life, Thom attended an additional nine burns over the past two years, including Burning Man 2013 and the inaugural Mosaic Experiment. Building large-scale burnable art has become a personal passion that brings him fulfillment and joy. His passion ignites a similar fire in anyone around him, bringing others into the community of transformation. A team of volunteers is already in place, helping to bring Our Hive into existence.

      Thom has experience with how to design and construct an effective project. He designed the inaugural structure for the Mosaic Experiment 2013. The Dodecamosaic touched and delighted many. The structure was designed so it could be rolled around, providing an interactive element for participants. Thom also contributed to building the inaugural Indiana C.O.R.E. project, INchanted Forest, for Burning Man 2013. We are thirsting for the opportunity to create a larger scale interactive project.


      What If?...

        If we don’t raise our goal of $1,190, then we will focus on in-person fundraising through selling patches and stickers at other festivals in the area. Additional funds  may be donated by existing team members and through personal gifts.

        The structure will be designed with the safety of all participants in mind. Walls and rafters will be reinforced to prevent accidental falls. On-site construction will include seasoned builders, including the lead builder of a 20 foot obelisk for another festival in 2013. This structure will be the most ambitious project for this festival, and we are pumped to make it happen!


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Whether or not you're able to donate please spread the word to everyone you know. Other burners, performers, artists, your wacky neighbor, your supervisor, that interesting guy you chatted up the other day - you know - everyone! And consider using the buttons below to spread the word online. Thank you - that is all.
story_txt:
In the heart of the Midwest, there is a vibrant community of
individuals dedicated to the idea of creating a space to enact self-reliance,
self-expression, respect of the environment, and the value of the common good.
These good folk will gather at a transformational festival in October, and this work will serve as the central effigy art project for the community.




Our campaign will fund only the material costs of a large-scale
burnable art installation for this festival
taking place in October. The structure, Our Hive, is an abstract geometric
representation of a beehive. The building allows for interaction in a variety
of ways. Participants can admire the structure’s intrinsic aesthetic beauty,
sit or cuddle in one of the numerous alcoves, lounge in the cargo net, or scale
to the top to look around. The structure will be illuminated with LED lighting
systems that bring the internal design and negative space into greater conscious
awareness. It will stand at around 18 feet tall with a rough
diameter of 20 feet at the base.
The festival organizers have already
awarded our team a $500 grant for the structure. We need your help to make up
the difference in cost for building materials. Our goal of $1,190 will cover
the lumber costs for the project.

  What We Need & What You Get


All of the funds raised will pay for the cost of the
materials to build and transport the structure to the festival site. This campaign to raise $1,190 will cover the cost of the
lumber for the 18 foot by 20 foot effigy. Additional costs not covered by this campaign include $1,800 to cover all remaining construction and transportation needs (e.g. internal netting: $170, hardware: $125, lighting: $100, truck rental: $385, and burn costs) Fuel, tools and construction space have already been donated.
If we do not meet our goal, all funds will still support the project, and we
will have to work even harder to raise money in person…
As a supporter of Our Hive, you'll receive our sincere gratitude, plus additional perks depending on the level of your contribution. These range from handwritten thank you notes to custom stickers to patches to the chance to light Our Hive on fire...in person!





The Impact




Our Hive will be the central art piece and effigy for a
transformational festival in Ohio. Dozens of these events occur across
the globe, and the movement is on the rise. With roots in the dreams of
activists, artists, hippies and seekers, transformational festivals create
radically free spaces where participants awaken to their inner selves and
experience a new way of being that springs from self-expression and community
interaction.
Here in the Midwest, this “dreams made real” opportunity is
rare. Opportunities to connect with like-minded folk who passionately believe
in the values of radical inclusion, radical self-expression, leaving no trace,
and the value of communal effort and civic responsibility are unusual. Burn
festivals create the opportunity for individuals to propel the next evolution
of humankind forward.


The Artist
In 2012, Thom Root attended his first burn festival. An unassuming software engineer in his regular life, Thom attended an additional nine burns over the past two years, including Burning Man 2013 and the inaugural Mosaic Experiment. Building large-scale burnable art has become a personal passion that brings him fulfillment and joy. His passion ignites a similar fire in anyone around him, bringing others into the community of transformation. A team of volunteers is already in place, helping to bring Our Hive into existence.


Thom has experience with how to design and construct an
effective project. He designed the inaugural structure for the Mosaic
Experiment 2013. The Dodecamosaic touched and delighted many. The structure was
designed so it could be rolled around, providing an interactive element for
participants. Thom also contributed to building the inaugural Indiana C.O.R.E.
project, INchanted Forest, for Burning Man 2013. We are thirsting for the opportunity
to create a larger scale interactive project.





  What If?...


If we don’t raise our goal of $1,190, then we will focus on
in-person fundraising through selling patches and stickers at other festivals
in the area. Additional funds  may be donated by existing team members and through personal gifts.
The structure will be designed with the safety of all
participants in mind. Walls and rafters will be reinforced to prevent
accidental falls. On-site construction will include seasoned builders,
including the lead builder of a 20 foot obelisk for another festival in 2013. This structure will be the most ambitious project for this festival, and we are pumped to make it happen!





  Other Ways You Can Help
Whether or not you're able to donate please spread the word to everyone you know. Other burners, performers, artists, your wacky neighbor, your supervisor, that interesting guy you chatted up the other day - you know - everyone! And consider using the buttons below to spread the word online. Thank you - that is all.

story:
Who is HHBS?

Helping Hands Bring Sunshine, a private 501 (c)(3) organization, is dedicated to improving the lives of those living in Croix de Bouquets, Haiti, through community support, education, and nutrition.

  • Fran Juste, a registered nurse originally from Haiti, founded HHBS in 2008 after multiple natural disasters devastated Haiti
  • HHBS has grown from a grass roots effort distributing basic necessities to hurricane victims in 2008, to rebuilding homes and schools destroyed in the earthquake of 2010, to our main focus today: supporting a school of 200+ students and faculty in the community of Croix de Bouquets
  • Through generation donations, HHBS rebuilt Ecole Scolaire de la Primitive, a school destroyed by the 2010 earthquake, purchased desks and blackboards, provided the necessary school supplies for each student, and in 2013 launched a program that provides one hot meal and clean drinking water for each student every day

How is HHBS Different?

Hand-to-hand distribution is what sets HHBS apart

  • Fran, the founder of HHBS, has a personal responsibility to make sure every donation is used to support the school
  • Each year, a team of HHBS Ambassadors travel to Haiti with drums full of school supplies and basic necessities
  • The items are hand delivered directly to the students and faculty
  • Please watch our video above to see hand-to-hand distribution in action
  • HHBS knows this level of involvement and dedication is the best way to help Haiti

How Can You Help?

We need your support to continue our mission of providing each student with education and nutrition.  Our Indiegogo campaign goal is to fully fund 20 of our 200 students for an entire school year.  Please help us feed a mind, one child at a time.


What Does it Take?

$625 Sponsors One Student for One School Year

And What Do You Get in Return?

Your donation will go directly to supporting the students and teachers.  In return, we have created some truly unique and thoughtful PERKS with our students in mind.  We want you to feel connected to the school, so we are making you part of it! From handwritten thank you notes to adding your name to the donor wall, you will forever be part of the school.

How To Get Involved

A donation in any amount is truly appreciated.  Please donate what you can and then:

●  Share our campaign with our friends through Facebook, Twitter and email!

●  Like our Facebook page!

●  Attend or volunteer at one of our upcoming events

story:
My name is Wen, I have been an IT support tech for nearly a decade. But my passion is in art; it was reignited by a caring community at Cubebrush.com and my art professor. 

My dream has always been deep rooted in video game art, Art brings everything to life from a flat drawing to 3D movies; art is the very inspiration of life. And I want to be a part of that and to share my joy and my creativity with the world!

What happens if you fund me?

Well with the 6000 dollars;
  1. I would be able to purchase a more professional grade Wacom drawing tablet.
  2. Upgrade certain components of my computer so that I can actually run the programs well and more efficiently(Memory, CPU etc).
  3. Purchase the software programs I need, other than the drawing program; there's 3D modeling programs as well and they're not cheap (ZBrush, Autodesk etc). 
  4. The most important part taking classes from http://cgmasteracademy.com/. They offer both 2D and 3D programs to help people like me become better artists. 

    The Impact of your contribution.

    Your contribution will let me acquire most of the essential tools I need to pursue my dream. 

    6,000 dollars will get me started on this journey. I started digital drawing 3 months ago and I've already made progress light years ahead of my own time. 

    With your help I can go even further in the pursuit of this dream.

    What are the risks and Challenges?

    The only risk I see is no electricity or my computer dying.

    How you would be helping me:

    You can help me spread the word on your Facebook and Twitter!



    So the benefit of each donation rank jumps significantly!

    But wait there's more!

    Regardless of how much you donate, you can get rewarded for sharing my campaign!


    So what are you waiting for? Hit the share buttons at the top of the page and help me get this show going!

    I want to be a concept artist and I need as many people to see this as possible to help make this dream come true.

story:
Illuminate your art here

"We are a group of independent artists working to launch an independent publishing platform for inspired open minded art lovers. Our illuminated art frames are a great way to display your favorite artist, photograph or signage graphics but we need to expand to survive and we need some help"
 - Scott Guy (Artist & Illuminated Frame maker)


ATTENTION
We now request you please enter the selected print id # into the comment window after you make your frame purchase. 
We realize the system for selecting prints is not ideal but please bear with us. You can find the art in the gallery and each piece has a id# that you will enter into the comments section of the page after you make your perk purchase. This way we can best track your order and record your art selection. This also leaves a comment trail after every purchase. Very good for improving out Gogofactor score.

***ALL ILLUMINATED FRAMES COME WITH PRINT!***
**LOCAL AREA PICKUP AVAILABLE FOR TORONTO AREA**

-Illuminated art - 
Select you frame type and then browse the selection of illuminated art prints in our gallery and remember to include the print # in your order details.
-Exclusive Indiegogo Contribution Perks -
Help us reach our goals and we will send you some fantastic perks only available through this campaign. Join us at our launch party, get some custom visionary art, or even purchase a legendary hand painted UV reactive psychedelic backdrop painting from founding artist Neil Gibson 

~Artists ~ 
Lumaframe's roster of artists includes well known masters and up and comers in the scene.  Check out our artists below: 
  • Andre Castro (Mexico/Toronto, Canada)
  • Ben Ridgway (California, USA)
  • Brandon Fernandes (Toronto, Canada)
  • Chris Dyer (Montreal,Canada)  
  • Czar Ar (Toronto, Can)
  • Cornelia Rose (Toronto, Can)
  • Hakan Hisim (Istanbul, Turkey)
  • Justin Brosey (Florida, USA)
  • Luminokaya (Russia/Nomad)
  • Neil Gibson (Collingwood, Can)
  • Paul Zulauf (Toronto, Can)
  • Yehudah Cullman (Toronto, Canada)
  • Scott Barber (Toronto, Canada)
  • Sam Brown (USA)
  • Xavi Panneton (California, USA)
  • Scott Guy (Toronto, Can)  and many more to come. 
We will be announcing more artists throughout the first few weeks of the campaign.   

~Lumaframes ~

Our Vision
  • The greater purpose of Lumaframes is to present a diverse collection of beautiful and inspirational art to the world through a sustainable business model and accessible product platform that in return will help support our contributing artists. 
Where we are today
  • We make High quality illuminated art and signage system with a multi setting remote for brightness, pattern, speed and RGBw color control
  • We currently offer two types of frames: Our flagship RGBw Auraframes and the classic white Lumaframes
  • Our low cost light weight illuminated frames are easy to ship and were designed with accessibility in mind. Our frames can ship worldwide for a fraction of the cost of traditional frames
  • Displayed in our unique frames, we feature a diverse selection of art created in a range of styles and media by a world class roster of artists
  • Lumaframes owns a large format fine art printer to print these beautiful pieces of work
  • 50% of the profit from all sales go directly to the artist
  • These frames and prints have been available at www.somethingpsychedelic.com as well as in stores and galleries around Toronto, Canada
What we are working on now ?
  • New Frame designs are already being worked on and we have prototypes soon. We need a little time and some funds to develop the design for our new frames and create a few prototypes.  We will have the product ready after a little hard work in the next few weeks
  • We need to improve the efficiency of the production line and shipping process. We need paper cutting templates and other custom tools to increase efficiency and consistent quality
  • Working really hard to promote our Illuminated art, the frames and the Lumaframes brand and idea of independently publishing illuminated art.
  • I am sourcing the best possible rates on all the materials we need 
  • Working on my art piece for the campaign perk and some other creative projects you will eventually see on www.lumaframes.com 
What do we need to do and how are we using the funds ? 
  • We will produce our latest version of Auraframes as well as the new and exciting solFrames and artisanFrames
  • Bulk order all resources needed to create Lumaframes and the included prints 
  • A new set of ink and more paper ! This is a critical requirement for us to continue making prints. Our minimum ink needs will cost nearly $1000
  • Bulk LED order. We order rolls of high quality waterproof RGBw LED lights 
  • Bulk frame shell order from our local Canadian manufacturer
  • Website Upgrade 
  • Our artist roster is growing and we need a more robust online system to keep track of our product and improve customer user experience. 
  • Your purchases help to relaunch our website at www.lumaframes.com . Once we expand the website we can then offer more than one collection of art with more artists and art pieces as well as increase our line of frame products. 
  • Rental of a temporary space so that we can put our products together and safely package and send them off to our customers around the world.

  • We will introduce new collections featuring creators of Children's illustration, Surrealism, Sci-Fi, Fantasy and Photography

    Our Relaunch :

    If we even get close to our goal funds will go back into the business for improving our process and to develop the website. We will also use a little of the $ to have a grand re opening party featuring top Toronto Psy scene talent and a huge showcase of Auraframes and our SomethingPsy Collection. This will be our display collection and we will be able to take it to other galleries shows and art markets. I would like to represent each artist with a few pieces and also be able to give artists demo copies.
    We need those funds to cover the extra ink  

The benefits to you for contributing today
  • Our Illuminated art on Indiegogo is available at a reduced price
  • Choose from selection of great perks and unreleased product pre-orders.   
  • Early Bird orders can get an even better discounted price while supplies last.
  • We are also offering custom fine art and photo printing services and hope some of you have visions or photos you would like to see printed and illuminated in our frames. Illuminate your life or at least your living room 
  • Please contribute and help realize the vision of a creative entrepreneur while also directly funding the artists involved. 
  • Your supporting small business and the local economy (MADE IN CANADA)
  • Satisfaction knowing your contribution supports a force of positive creation


Make your own Auraframe with us!
We also aim to add Photography, Children's Illustration, Surrealism, SCI-fi and Fantasy collections along with our current Visionary and Psychedelic art lineup. 


    ~ NEW FRAMES IN IN DEVELOPMENT ~

    We have 2 new frame types we are making available through this campaign as PRE-ORDER PERKS
    More exciting illuminated framing options for all budgets and types home or gallery.
    There are also new mod kits we are working on and we hope to deliver options to our customers like battery powered lights, weather resistant frames and a special nightlight version for kids with s photo sensor to turn it on in the dark.
    SolFrames -  (AWESOME NEW ITEM ! MAKE YOUR PRE ORDER TODAY!)
    • Barely visible clear lexan sheets held together by strong magnets. These floating borderless frames look incredible in bright natural sunlight.
    • solFrames will come in 3 sizes and have small hanging kit so you can hang in a window or have it sitting on a sill or table.
      (concept image below, full prototype on the way)


    Artisan Frames     
    • This will be our ultra premium illuminated frame suitable for high end galleries or at home in the finest estate. Currently in prototype faze this handcrafted fine wood frame built by our skilled carpenter Scott Barber will be a joy to have on your wall and a piece you hold onto for a lifetime.  
      (In Progress)



    ~ PERKS ~

    (Browse the selection of illuminated art prints in our gallery and remember to include the print # in the comments section. )
    (You can take your time to pick your art as long as you make your decision by end of the campaign Nov 22nd.) *ALL FRAME ORDERS INCLUDE ART!*

    • Entry Level Perks : Send us a few bucks and get the exclusive desktop wallpaper download pack and our sincere gratitude for your show of support. Entry to our re launch campaign party or a killer something psy special edition Hat. ($5 - $75)

    • Campaign edition print by Scott Guy : Scott is in progress on a new vision that will be completed and delivered to contributors at this level.($40)

    • solFrame PRE-ORDER : Our newest frame style is nearly invisible and hangs a high resolution art print in your window picking up the natural glow of the sunlight. (6" $30,  12" $60) INCLUDING PRINT !!!

    • Auraframes : You can help support this vision of by purchasing your very own illuminated art piece at a discounted price special for this campaign. Current Gen frames will be delivered by December 2014
    • ($85 - $140 each INCLUDES ART!)

    • Auraframe Artisan Edition PRE-ORDER : Handcrafted elegant wooden frames featuring out back lit illuminated art prints. A true show piece that works in the most refined and visually demanding environments. The frame itself is a limited edition work of art. ($500)

    • Combo Perks : Get your own collection of illuminated art for an even bigger discount and we can throw in most of the other perks too if you like.

    • Top Level Perks : Original artworks by something psy artists. Large scale UV paintings and original art collaborations creating personal visionary art portraits. ($600 - $4500)

    All art purchases will be honored and delivered. These are sales not just donations. If we do not make the goal we will have to alter the plans to have a party and and reconsider the pursuit of our business and publishing goals. It would be hard to do more on my own like develop new products, publish new artists and increase the size and variety of the collections but we will absolutely honor and deliver on all art sales from this campaign guaranteed.

    "All we need to build this dream of an even greater illuminated art publishing platform is Something like around 50 Illuminated art purchases, maybe a few pre-orders for our up coming frame products and then top it off with some generous backers who want to pick up the perks and come out to out the grand re-opening event ! Its not really that much when you think about the global audience we have here and just how awesome is this art right ??"

    We have the amazing collection of international artists. We have the printer, we have the Auraframes design and we have the beginnings of a great online illuminated art sales platform.

    ~ If we can pass our goal what's next ? ~

    Answer : Endless work to keep a business going and find time to make more art. 
    Once we restock and are filling some orders we can begin to look forward again and continue to improve.
    • With large enough LED order I plan to make specifications  for prefab electronics assembly by the manufacturer 
      (extra upfront cost saves so much time later when filling orders). 
    • Improve production process and tools. I have ideas for greatly reducing production costs but these processes require large orders. 
    • Branding refocus and website community features. I need time to arrange, design and implement all the advanced features we would like to make available to customers and artists.  
    • Even further ahead I have a totally new LED frame design that will be borderless and can be made much larger than our current models.  
    • Promotional materials and online advertising, Banners, Flyers, Biz Cards, ads, illuminate your art app. 
    • We would print display pieces if we have enough funds and have showings of the various collections at different events galleries and other venues.
    • Use display collection at art show booths and festivals. Attract more artists.
    • Further develop the community upload and custom print business. 
    • Feature Lumaframes in other online stores and retail outlets. 
    • Sponsor art and charity events (traveling gallery) 
    • Ideally I find a workable studio space to dedicate to our printing and frame assembly production. A production area and art studio with a showroom in the front one day would be perfect. I think a storefront like this would be beautiful.

    About the creator 
    • Frame products and this campaign were created by Scott Guy - Owner and curator of Lumaframes and the Something Psychedelic collection.
    • Scott is a creative entrepreneur who currently works as a multimedia artist, freelance designer, projection installation technician and Vj.  
    • With past experience of some ten years in the video game and interactive software industry. Scott is also known to break out the gloves as a craftsman
    • Scott developed and refined the illuminated frame box design over time until it was a product he could be happy with and wanted to show in his own home. 
      He is now hatching new plans for more exciting illuminated frame products.
    • The original motivation for making these frames was to create an interesting way to display the art my friends and myself are creating. It quickly became something more . A platform that enables artists to share their creations in a new and interesting way with a greater global audience. 
    If we further develop our frame product line and improve the art collection I am confident this project will take off. Once the base structure is built up we will be able to keep the ball rolling.
      Your contribution or illuminated art purchase will bring illuminated art into your home and help our business grow.  Everyone Wins ! 

      Shine light into dark corners and lift your heart with illuminated visionary art.

      We have been selling the highest quality translucent geclee prints in our illuminated art frames for nearly two years and are committed to improving the service and product quality over time regardless of the success of this campaign.

      Right now we are facing a number of challenges like having the correct materials supply and then the space the produce the orders in reasonable time. We are working towards streamlining our shipping process and some funds will be going into upgrading our production and packaging process. We have had trouble filling orders once or twice due to being low on ink or missing a light component but with a little help from our followers and the indiegogo community we can stock up so that won't ever happen again and we can deliver our visionary images to the world.  


      Visionary art is a powerful movement and part of a transformational culture phenomenon. We hope to spread the positive light of these mind opening visions and inspire people to work toward a better world and relationships with each other. The color changing back lit Auraframes are the ideal platform to deliver our collection of incredible art to the world.

      KEEP WATCHING THE CAMPAIGN FOR UPDATES ON OUR PROGRESS AND TO SEE THE LATEST WIP images of our new art and products coming to you soon.

      Any supporters who are unable to purchase an art piece or one of our perks can still help us out a bunch by sharing this campaign link. http://igg.me/at/lumaframes

      Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
      thank you very much for your interest in our campaign. Please consider helping us reach our goal.

Bulk frame shell order from our local Canadian manufacturer
Website Upgrade 
Our artist roster is growing and we need a more robust online system to keep track of our product and improve customer user experience. 

Your purchases help to relaunch our website at www.lumaframes.com . Once we expand the website we can then offer more than one collection of art with more artists and art pieces as well as increase our line of frame products. 
Rental of a temporary space so that we can put our products together and safely package and send them off to our customers around the world.


We will introduce new collections featuring creators of Children's illustration, Surrealism, Sci-Fi, Fantasy and Photography
Our Relaunch :If we even get close to our goal funds will go back into the business for improving our process and to develop the website. We will also use a little of the $ to have a grand re opening party featuring top Toronto Psy scene talent and a huge showcase of Auraframes and our SomethingPsy Collection. This will be our display collection and we will be able to take it to other galleries shows and art markets. I would like to represent each artist with a few pieces and also be able to give artists demo copies.We need those funds to cover the extra ink  

The benefits to you for contributing today

Our Illuminated art on Indiegogo is available at a reduced price
Choose from selection of great perks and unreleased product pre-orders.   
Early Bird orders can get an even better discounted price while supplies last.
We are also offering custom fine art and photo printing services and hope some of you have visions or photos you would like to see printed and illuminated in our frames. Illuminate your life or at least your living room 
Please contribute and help realize the vision of a creative entrepreneur while also directly funding the artists involved. 
Your supporting small business and the local economy (MADE IN CANADA)
Satisfaction knowing your contribution supports a force of positive creation


Make your own Auraframe with us!We also aim to add Photography, Children's Illustration, Surrealism, SCI-fi and Fantasy collections along with our current Visionary and Psychedelic art lineup. 



~ NEW FRAMES IN IN DEVELOPMENT ~
We have 2 new frame types we are making available through this campaign as PRE-ORDER PERKSMore exciting illuminated framing options for all budgets and types home or gallery.There are also new mod kits we are working on and we hope to deliver options to our customers like battery powered lights, weather resistant frames and a special nightlight version for kids with s photo sensor to turn it on in the dark.

SolFrames -  (AWESOME NEW ITEM ! MAKE YOUR PRE ORDER TODAY!)



Barely visible clear lexan sheets held together by strong magnets. These floating borderless frames look incredible in bright natural sunlight.

solFrames will come in 3 sizes and have small hanging kit so you can hang in a window or have it sitting on a sill or table.(concept image below, full prototype on the way)



Artisan Frames 
This will be our ultra premium illuminated frame suitable for high end galleries or at home in the finest estate. Currently in prototype faze this handcrafted fine wood frame built by our skilled carpenter Scott Barber will be a joy to have on your wall and a piece you hold onto for a lifetime.  (In Progress)




~ PERKS ~(Browse the selection of illuminated art prints in our gallery and remember to include the print # in the comments section. )(You can take your time to pick your art as long as you make your decision by end of the campaign Nov 22nd.) *ALL FRAME ORDERS INCLUDE ART!*
Entry Level Perks : Send us a few bucks and get the exclusive desktop wallpaper download pack and our sincere gratitude for your show of support. Entry to our re launch campaign party or a killer something psy special edition Hat. ($5 - $75)
Campaign edition print by Scott Guy : Scott is in progress on a new vision that will be completed and delivered to contributors at this level.($40)
solFrame PRE-ORDER : Our newest frame style is nearly invisible and hangs a high resolution art print in your window picking up the natural glow of the sunlight. (6" $30,  12" $60) INCLUDING PRINT !!!

Auraframes : You can help support this vision of by purchasing your very own illuminated art piece at a discounted price special for this campaign. Current Gen frames will be delivered by December 2014

($85 - $140 each INCLUDES ART!)
Auraframe Artisan Edition PRE-ORDER : Handcrafted elegant wooden frames featuring out back lit illuminated art prints. A true show piece that works in the most refined and visually demanding environments. The frame itself is a limited edition work of art. ($500)
Combo Perks : Get your own collection of illuminated art for an even bigger discount and we can throw in most of the other perks too if you like.

Top Level Perks : Original artworks by something psy artists. Large scale UV paintings and original art collaborations creating personal visionary art portraits. ($600 - $4500)


All art purchases will be honored and delivered. These are sales not just donations. If we do not make the goal we will have to alter the plans to have a party and and reconsider the pursuit of our business and publishing goals. It would be hard to do more on my own like develop new products, publish new artists and increase the size and variety of the collections but we will absolutely honor and deliver on all art sales from this campaign guaranteed."All we need to build this dream of an even greater illuminated art publishing platform is Something like around 50 Illuminated art purchases, maybe a few pre-orders for our up coming frame products and then top it off with some generous backers who want to pick up the perks and come out to out the grand re-opening event ! Its not really that much when you think about the global audience we have here and just how awesome is this art right ??"


We have the amazing collection of international artists. We have the printer, we have the Auraframes design and we have the beginnings of a great online illuminated art sales platform.



~ If we can pass our goal what's next ? ~

Answer : Endless work to keep a business going and find time to make more art. Once we restock and are filling some orders we can begin to look forward again and continue to improve.


With large enough LED order I plan to make specifications  for prefab electronics assembly by the manufacturer (extra upfront cost saves so much time later when filling orders). 
Improve production process and tools. I have ideas for greatly reducing production costs but these processes require large orders. 
Branding refocus and website community features. I need time to arrange, design and implement all the advanced features we would like to make available to customers and artists.  

Even further ahead I have a totally new LED frame design that will be borderless and can be made much larger than our current models.  

Promotional materials and online advertising, Banners, Flyers, Biz Cards, ads, illuminate your art app. 
We would print display pieces if we have enough funds and have showings of the various collections at different events galleries and other venues.
Use display collection at art show booths and festivals. Attract more artists.
Further develop the community upload and custom print business. 
Feature Lumaframes in other online stores and retail outlets. 
Sponsor art and charity events (traveling gallery) 
Ideally I find a workable studio space to dedicate to our printing and frame assembly production. A production area and art studio with a showroom in the front one day would be perfect. I think a storefront like this would be beautiful.


About the creator 

Frame products and this campaign were created by Scott Guy - Owner and curator of Lumaframes and the Something Psychedelic collection.
Scott is a creative entrepreneur who currently works as a multimedia artist, freelance designer, projection installation technician and Vj.  
With past experience of some ten years in the video game and interactive software industry. Scott is also known to break out the gloves as a craftsman
Scott developed and refined the illuminated frame box design over time until it was a product he could be happy with and wanted to show in his own home. He is now hatching new plans for more exciting illuminated frame products.
The original motivation for making these frames was to create an interesting way to display the art my friends and myself are creating. It quickly became something more . A platform that enables artists to share their creations in a new and interesting way with a greater global audience. 

If we further develop our frame product line and improve the art collection I am confident this project will take off. Once the base structure is built up we will be able to keep the ball rolling.


Your contribution or illuminated art purchase will bring illuminated art into your home and help our business grow.  Everyone Wins ! 

Shine light into dark corners and lift your heart with illuminated visionary art.
We have been selling the highest quality translucent geclee prints in our illuminated art frames for nearly two years and are committed to improving the service and product quality over time regardless of the success of this campaign.Right now we are facing a number of challenges like having the correct materials supply and then the space the produce the orders in reasonable time. We are working towards streamlining our shipping process and some funds will be going into upgrading our production and packaging process. We have had trouble filling orders once or twice due to being low on ink or missing a light component but with a little help from our followers and the indiegogo community we can stock up so that won't ever happen again and we can deliver our visionary images to the world.  


Visionary art is a powerful movement and part of a transformational culture phenomenon. We hope to spread the positive light of these mind opening visions and inspire people to work toward a better world and relationships with each other. The color changing back lit Auraframes are the ideal platform to deliver our collection of incredible art to the world.

KEEP WATCHING THE CAMPAIGN FOR UPDATES ON OUR PROGRESS AND TO SEE THE LATEST WIP images of our new art and products coming to you soon.


Any supporters who are unable to purchase an art piece or one of our perks can still help us out a bunch by sharing this campaign link. http://igg.me/at/lumaframes

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!thank you very much for your interest in our campaign. Please consider helping us reach our goal.

story:
Zentai Art Festival 2014 (www.zentaiart.com) is a first art festival focused on Zentai Art in the world.  There are 3 exhibitions and 5 performances with 27 artists in Singapore from November 2014 to June 2015:

  • Zentai is a full body tights covering whole body.
  • Our world is too external oriented.  The way we look affects in our job and personal life.  Though this zentai art, we look inwards where human surface, gender, age and looks does not matter.  Within ourselves, we will find something more deep and real.
  • Anyone can wear zentai and be transformed to a super hero.
  • We need Artist fee for artists to make their art works and gallery rental fee for showing art works.

  • I am an artist working on the 'Zentai Art Project' for 4 years. I make video and performance with the Zentai suits. My project is called 'Zentai Art Project' (yuzuru.weebly.com). I want to share this 'Zentai Art' with the world.
  • Our team is seasoned for organising art events. We have organised various art festivals in Singapore includes 'Rites' which was a series of performance art events.
  • We are very passionate about sharing the art with the artists and audiences.  We believe the art can make changes in our small life.


  • No identity
  • No gender
  • No age
  • No race
  • No country
  • No religion 
  • No language
  • No name
  • No thought
  • No limitation
  • This exhibition is about human identity and asking question ‘who we are?’. We focus on transcending manmade-rules and limitation psychologically and physically, taking away the social taboos in relationships between individuals. By neutralizing age, gender and surface beauty and rendering it non-identical, it asks the question of identity in the context of the urban living conditions in Singapore. It will present many different realities from individual artists and practitioners as a showcase of their interpretation and perspectives on Zentai art.

We are ready to make this next big step, but we need your help to make it as big as we possibly can! Funds from Indiegogo will be used for:

  • Bigger and better festival quality. With this budget, we can promote the Zentai art to the world.  We can create a new category in the contemporary art as 'Zentai Art'
  • Artist fee. We need to pay the artists to make their art works.  We also need transportation/accommodation for foreign artists.
  • Gallery rental. We need to pay our festival host to host our exhibitions.
  • Performance venue rental.  The performance are happening at the theatre.
  • Equipments and marketing. We need material like zentai suits, sound system and also marketing  for the festival.



  • Zentai art is not recognised art yet in the world.  It is hard to get funds from the Government or organisation .
  • There are art proposals from the artists and artists are already making their art works.  Art galleries are also confirmed to host us. Now we are working on the logistics.  

  • The exhibitions and performances are free to enter.  We will have festival documentation uploaded to the website for people who cannot come to Singapore.
  • With the success of the festival, the festival will go around the world engaging local artists introducing the 'Zentai Art'.
