6 X 9 (matte) digital print, edition of 50


PERK 3


16 X 20 (luster) digital print poster, edition of 50

1 Set of graphite sticks from an early performance, 1/17

First come, first serve basis.  
You may email me at info@tonyorrico.com before submitting your donation 
to inquire about availability of sticks from specific performances.
Link to my archives to reference an image of each drawing.

story:
WHAT IS ALCHEMIA?

Alchemia provides arts programming for adults with developmental disabilities who identify as artists or who are passionate about deepening their artistic, social, and communication skills through the expressive arts. Alchemia is committed to providing a physically, socially, and artistically nourishing environment where participants can develop and sustain strong interpersonal relationships, pursue individual creative goals, and explore their unique dreams.

WHAT IS “CREATED EQUAL” ABOUT?

“Created Equal” will be a documentary about the artists of Alchemia, who display and sell their artwork at the A.W.O.L (Artists Without Labels) gallery in Petaluma, California. This film allows the artists to tell their own stories in their unique words and images. As their art is brought to life through animation, the audience will learn the inspiring stories of each Alchemia artist and what their creations mean to them. The film will also focus on the cycle of joy and positive emotions created when these artists show and sell their work to the public.

The artists of Alchemia are the most optimistic and courageous people I have ever met, and it is a privilege to teach and create with them They are inspiring individuals who can show us all a great deal about what it means to live a passionate, purposeful life. When you meet them through the “Created Equal” film, you will understand and appreciate the joy of what it really means to be alive.

WHAT DOES JULIE NEWMAR HAVE TO DO WITH THE PROJECT?

Julie (Catwoman) Newmar has agreed to narrate “Created Equal”. I met her in the 1980”s at the Barnsdall Park Art Gallery in Los Angeles. Out of the corner of my eye, I spotted her sitting alone on the floor, leaning over her toddler. He was reaching up and playing with her long blonde hair. As I looked closer, I saw that her son had Down’s Syndrome. Like many other fans, I had always been in love with Catwoman, and this scene touched my heart and has remained there all these years. I contacted her when I started the “Created Equal” project and sent her some of the work my students had created.. She loved the films we have done in our Alchemia Animation class, such as “Parking” and “Trash Talk”. She was so enthusiastic about this project that she agreed to do the narration and I am so proud and honored to have her play a key role in this special film.

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

$20,000 will get us good editing, some archival footage, animation, and music. It will also allow us to enter film festivals and promote the film to find a distributor. The goal is to finish the film by early Fall. If we get more than we ask for, we will be able to afford a higher quality production. If we get less, the film will still get made, but it may be a short instead of a feature.

WHAT WILL YOU GET FOR YOUR DONATION?

At different donation levels, donors will get perks such as a "thank you" in the film credits, “Created Equal Crew” T shirts, a DVD of the film, an Alchema artist’s drawing of your car, a two-hour caricature session by the director of the film, photos of Catwoman autographed by Julie Newmar, and an associate producer credit in the film.

TELL ME ABOUT THE FILMMAKER

Gene Hamm, is an animation instructor at Academy of Art University San Francisco, CA, and animation and special effects instructor at Alchemia. He worked in Hollywood on such projects as Ralph Bakshi’s Lord of the Rings, Hanna-Barbera’s Smurfs and Superfriends, MTV’s Liquid Television, Roger Corman’s Battle Beyond the Stars, and Art Clokey’s Gumby. His own projects include his feature The Dream Hat, the instructional video Cartooning Shortcuts, Formulas & Cheap Tricks. You can see more of his work on his website and his YouTube Channel.

HOW CAN YOU HELP?

You could contribute money. Or you could tell everyone you know about “Created Equal” through Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, Pinterest, email, phone calls, or just stick your head out the window and yell. We appreciate anything and everything you can do, and we thank you in advance for helping us show the students of Alchemia to the world!

story:
20 artists at 20 years

For 20 years, the Byck family has built a winery in the Sonoma County foothills, and for much of that time, they have made world class sculpture a part of their vision. The oak grove, the meadow, the bluff, even the parking lot by the bottling plant are all filled with art, all free and open to the public seven days a week. To help celebrate their 20th year, the Voigt Family Sculpture Foundation is installing 20 works of art at the winery. The exhibition opens on June 22, 2014.

  • The art is accessible to the public, at no charge, seven days a week in a remarkable natural setting.
  • We provide opportunities for artists' work to be seen and enjoyed, and for anyone to see art outside the confines of a gallery.
  • This will be the largest sculpture exhibit in the North Bay in 2014-2015, and you can be part of it.

We Are Seeking Matching Funds

Curating and installing 20 works of art is a complex undertaking. Many of these works require special equipment to assemble and install. And there are materials costs, transportation, marketing, organizing ... it adds up fast!

  • The Voigt Family Sculpture Foundation is providing upfront costs and organizational expertise. All donations go strictly to offset costs incurred by our 501(c)(3) charitable foundation.
  • We get it about perks and we believe we've chosen unique and exciting gifts for you that reflect the creativity and impact of this exhibition. Want to go on vacation or learn to weld? How about both? Check out the perks!
  • We've got skin in this game too. Our foundation will match all donations.

The Impact You Can Make

Two years ago, the Voigt Family Sculpture Foundation began to partner with Paradise Ridge Winery to curate and present sculpture exhibitions that are free to the public, seven days a week. The winery has always supported and exhibited sculpture, but our partnership allows more art to be seen by more people.

  • Supporting 20@20 allows us to present 20 exciting works of art to the community. The artists benefit from exposure to the community and art lovers benefit from being able to see new works in a beautiful natural setting.
  • We know what we're doing. We've installed dozens of works of art in public places throughout Sonoma County, and this is our third year partnering with Paradise Ridge Winery.
  • We can't do it without you and we invite you to share our vision of art that is not locked up in galleries, where there are no guards saying "Don't touch." Every work of art can be seen, touched and loved by everyone, every day.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still help!

  • Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Post a link on Facebook or Twitter, email your friends, or tell people in coffee shops.
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thanks so much for checking us out!

story:
Greetings World! My name is Noah Saunders and I'm asking you for a small donation to procure the sum of $2,584 to manifest the answer to my prayer.... 

The Story

I've been a full time metal sculptor for the past 20 years. About ten years ago I got a bag of clay and went about making little pots by hand knowing next to nothing about what I was doing and very scared that I would 'make a mistake'.  However, this naivety led me to create hand built forms with great proficiency and uniqueness.  Soon I had  hundreds of round bottom bowls laying all over my studio!  Looking over my "collection" one day, I thought why not make these bowls into something more complete.  Merging my knowledge of metal forging with my new passion for ceramics I transformed my bowls into Chalices!  Creating a unique method of attaching a copper base to a ceramic form, holding it together with tension - no glue or solder!  Around this time I had been volunteering at a local clay studio which gave me access to a lot of great equipment and clay, feeding my passion!  

The Story Takes on Twist

The copper on the clay body had a very ancient feel to it and one day I showed my new body of work to a dear friend who is an Egyptologist.  He was very excited about what I was doing and said that I ought to study the ceramics of the Ancient Near East.  I went straight the library and felt like I had found a time and people that were kindred spirits as the work I saw was just like mine!!!  But not quite as  the clay that was used in the BC was fired at a much lower temperature and glaze had not been invented yet.  Near Eastern ceramics had a much more organic feel that was really inspiring. I went to the studio I was working in and announced that I wanted to create forms that were inspired by the work of the Ancient Near East; I wanted to be a B.C. Potter! My announcement was responded with by a wall of resistance. :(  .  Most ceramic artist had little knowledge of the work of the Near East and were not open to aiding me on my quest to create the clay forms using a more ancient language.  Undeterred, I continued to experiment and work in the studio hoping that I could find a happy medium using their required materials but trying top create a BC feel. Soon however it became apparent that I could not use the High fired clay to make a form satisfactory for what I envisioned.  I felt like a B.C. boy trapped in an A.D. world! 

Never give UP!!!

Through the encouragement of friends, I did lots of research finding the exact forms I wanted to make, along with the clays that would be appropriate to make a chalice that had a real B.C. feel. Armed with this research  I hit the streets and asked every potter and public clay studio I could find about using their  kilns - I might as well have been carrying a skunk!!!  No one wished to open there kiln to me - the work was just too far outside of the norm. I wanted to make low fired forms made of red and black clays which would look so nice next to the copper, clay bodies that were unglazed having the BC look that I am so called to create! It was starting to feel like a novel that was doomed to be never be published.  Exhausted I shelved the idea for a few years. Good ideas die hard I guess because soon my home and computer became so full of books and images of work that inspired me, it was all I would talk about.  The BC was banging on my creative door and I was either going to honor this dream or have to kill it!

 

Prayer is Answered!

One day after poring over a book on the Ceramics of the Sudan and spending the afternoon sketching, I was overcome with grief!  How long can I continue to carry this creative baby?  Exhausted I began to pray - I asked my Higher Power for guidance, and instantly received a very clear message over and over: HONOR YOUR DREAM. MAKE YOUR OWN STUDIO! How could I ever afford that?!?!?! I went to my office and checked my email; finding an email from one of the clay studios I worked in: kiln for sale. Without fear I called the number listed.  That is when the Universe introduced me to Sarah, a ceramic sculptor of 40 years who was not just selling a kiln but an entire clay studio!  Oh and she wanted to know if I would like her low fired BLACK CLAY!

PRAYER ANSWERED!!!!

What I Need & What You Get

  • One amazing clay kiln, shelves, glazes, tables, clay, tools, turn table for hand building, how-to books: $1,000
  • Electric hook up fee: $750
  • Shipping and Handling: In order to ship all the artwork out that you buy, I'll need at least $350 (ceramic work is heavy and won't be cheap to ship). 
  • $200 to purchase the rest of my clay needs to set me up for at least 6 months.
  • $100 to compensate my dear friend whose computer help allowed this to go live!
  • Indiegogo takes 4% of what I raise, and other transaction fees take another 4%, so for this subtraction I want to allow for an extra $184.
  • Total: 2584

Rewards:

Look to the right for the full list of rewards! All original pieces made by me.

Note that the ceramics shown below are examples of the type of vessel or token available.  You will receive a unique version of that type :D






Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't at a place to contribute financially, I can still use your help! Please share this page and any of my pictures on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. The more people who hear about this the more likely I am to meet my goal!

"collection" one day, I thought why not make these bowls into something 
more complete.  Merging my knowledge of metal forging with my new 
passion for ceramics I transformed my bowls into Chalices!  Creating a 
unique method of attaching a copper base to a ceramic form, holding it 
together with tension - no glue or solder!  Around this time I had been 
volunteering at a local clay studio which gave me access to a lot of 
great equipment and clay, feeding my passion!  The Story Takes on Twist
The
 copper on the clay body had a very ancient feel to it and one day I 
showed my new body of work to a dear friend who is an Egyptologist.  He 
was very excited about what I was doing and said that I ought to study 
the ceramics of the Ancient Near East.  I went straight the library and 
felt like I had found a time and people that were kindred spirits as the
 work I saw was just like mine!!!  But not quite as  the clay that was 
used in the BC was fired at a much lower temperature and glaze had not 
been invented yet.  Near Eastern ceramics had a much more organic feel 
that was really inspiring. I went to the studio I was working in and 
announced that I wanted to create forms that were inspired by the work 
of the Ancient Near East; I wanted to be a B.C. Potter! My announcement 
was responded with by a wall of resistance. :(  .  Most ceramic artist 
had little knowledge of the work of the Near East and were not open to 
aiding me on my quest to create the clay forms using a more ancient 
language.  Undeterred, I continued to experiment and work in the studio 
hoping that I could find a happy medium using their required materials 
but trying top create a BC feel. Soon however it became apparent that I 
could not use the High fired clay to make a form satisfactory for what I
 envisioned.  I felt like a B.C. boy trapped in an A.D. world!  Never give UP!!!Through
 the encouragement of friends, I did lots of research finding the exact 
forms I wanted to make, along with the clays that would be appropriate 
to make a chalice that had a real B.C. feel. Armed with this research  I
 hit the streets and asked every potter and public clay studio I could 
find about using their  kilns - I might as well have been carrying a 
skunk!!!  No one wished to open there kiln to me - the work was just too
 far outside of the norm. I wanted to make low fired forms made of red 
and black clays which would look so nice next to the copper, clay bodies
 that were unglazed having the BC look that I am so called to create! It
 was starting to feel like a novel that was doomed to be never be 
published.  Exhausted I shelved the idea for a few years. Good ideas die
 hard I guess because soon my home and computer became so full of books 
and images of work that inspired me, it was all I would talk about.  The
 BC was banging on my creative door and I was either going to honor this
 dream or have to kill it!  Prayer is Answered!
One
 day after poring over a book on the Ceramics of the Sudan and spending 
the afternoon sketching, I was overcome with grief!  How long can I 
continue to carry this creative baby?  Exhausted I began to pray - I 
asked my Higher Power for guidance, and instantly received a very clear 
message over and over: HONOR YOUR DREAM. MAKE YOUR OWN STUDIO! How could
 I ever afford that?!?!?! I went to my office and checked my email; 
finding an email from one of the clay studios I worked in: kiln for 
sale. Without fear I called the number listed.  That is when the 
Universe introduced me to Sarah, a ceramic sculptor of 40 years who was 
not just selling a kiln but an entire clay studio!  Oh and she wanted to
 know if I would like her low fired BLACK CLAY! PRAYER ANSWERED!!!!What I Need & What You Get
One amazing clay kiln, shelves, glazes, tables, clay, tools, turn table for hand building, how-to books: $1,000
Electric hook up fee: $750
Shipping and Handling: In order to ship all the artwork out that 
you buy, I'll need at least $350 (ceramic work is heavy and won't be 
cheap to ship). 
$200 to purchase the rest of my clay needs to set me up for at least 6 months.
$100 to compensate my dear friend whose computer help allowed this to go live!

Indiegogo takes 4% of what I raise, and other transaction fees take 
another 4%, so for this subtraction I want to allow for an extra $184.
Total: 2584
Rewards:Look to the right for the full list of rewards! All original pieces made by me. Note that the ceramics shown below are examples of the type of vessel 
or token available.  You will receive a unique version of that type :D







Other Ways You Can HelpIf
 you aren't at a place to contribute financially, I can still use your 
help! Please share this page and any of my pictures on Facebook, 
Instagram, Twitter, etc. The more people who hear about this the more 
likely I am to meet my goal!

story:
The ÜTFD mission: 

Last year we fell a long way short of our funding goal to build four propane fire puffers for the Übertown Fire department. Furthermore the high levels of wind on site meant that the design for the two that we did build was not wind-proof enough to work on site. Fortunately we were able to salvage the fire puffers from Gladys and got them working for you all on 2 of our party nights.


Our plan this year is to improve on our Übertown fire department fire puffers, with a new ignition system and sheltered pilot light, and also to give Gladys' old fire puffers a full makeover, with new regulators, wicks and igniters.
Without giving too much away about this year's party space, the fire puffers will be positioned to make the dance area an even more engaging and exciting a place to be, and we plan to have fully integrated audio-pyro synchronisation for a truly thrilling experience for all our party goers. This is in addition to an all new soundsystem, and massively upgraded theatrical set pieces. 

Wait, what is ÜTFD??

Übertown, Nowhere Festival’s largest, most adventurous party space is a dieselpunk, post-apocalyptic totalitarian state, run by its benevolent dictator, an 18 month old baby named 'El Presidente'. Building on the success of last year, we’re pulling out all the stops and are once again setting a new bar for the level of detail and art in Barrio design and decor. The Übertown Fire Department operates a pyrotechnic show within Übertown, being the first and only group to do so since the sad demise of Gladys the 'fire' engine. 
What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise £1650 in order to pay for propane and equipment. Simple. 

£1000 of this is the money we need to end up with. We will spend £500 on perks, and we will lose approx £150 to indiegogo and transaction fees. 

It’s important to us that you get something for your contribution so we’ve designed a load of Übertown swag as perks. 

Of course you can opt out of receiving a reward and help us reach our target faster. You will therefore see a number of options to donate money which don't include a physical perk, other than pinbadge and sticker. These include outright paying for a gas bottle and naming the remaining fire cannon. 


Where ever possible, perks will be supplied in person (Nowhere, London Burning Pub, Regional Burn Events, etc). If this is unsuitable, postage can be arranged at cost.

Should we find ourselves in the fortunate position of beating our goal, any additional funds will go towards more gas for longer, hotter & more fiery fun for all!



Thank you for your time and donation. See you in the dust underneath the warm fiery glow of the Übertown Fire Department.

story:
The imagination of a modeler is a limitless pool of inspiration and imagination, give him the correct tools and knowledge and his creations will be spectacular!

After many workshop and multiple conversations I had with modelers from around the world, I saw that the interest in figure sculpting has increased substantially and continues to be on the rise within the figure modeling community.

Many figure modelers want to go to the next level, to create their own scratch built miniatures, so I decided to release a series of ultimate anatomy kits that will assist them to reach their goals.

The “Michael Kontraros – Ultimate Anatomy Kit” has been created to provide significant advantages from the other anatomy kits available on the market. Each box will include:

  1. One complete miniature figure, which the modeler can dress and convert as he wants.

  2. One unassembled (in parts) fully poseable miniature with 3 different interchangeable set of hands on which the muscle structure has been already sculpted.

  3. Wire to create the posture/stance of the fully possible miniature.

  4. Instructions for the correct assembly of the fully possible miniature / anatomical correct and scaled guidelines – in order to avoid anatomical mistakes.

The “Michael Kontraros – Ultimate Anatomy Kit” will be available in the accurate scales of 75 mm, 54 mm and for the first time 40mm and more importantly in male and female sets.

All the years that I have been involved with the sculpting of figure miniatures I remember myself looking to find skulls to use as a base when sculpting heads and faces. I could not find anatomically correct skulls so I had to sculpt my own. In order to make the modelers life easier I decided to make a series of skulls in the scales of 75 / 54 / 40 mm.

What makes these skulls unique is that they are anatomically PERFECT. They are from a 3D scan of a real skull used for medical purposes and printed on an HD 3D printer.

This is a big project! A lot of scales, a lot of boxes, a lot of molds and a lot of copies!Your contribution is very important in order for the whole idea to be utilized and for the figure to be molded, copied, packaged and released.

story:
The campaign is finished and I want THANK everyone who helped, contributed and supported me with this fundraiser!! Now on to the real adventure!!



Newly Added Stop!!!

-Danaca Design Seattle Washington

Danaca Design is a metal crafting center which offers classes and has a gallery space where they show profession/amateur and local artists.
"All students of the Metal Crafting Center are encouraged to exhibit their successes in the gallery, as space is always reserved for them!"
I will be teaching my cold connection workshop at this center. Thanks to Dana at Danaca Design for helping put this together. I look forward to hanging out with y'all in Seattle. 
-Quench Jewelry Arts Minneapolis Minnesota 

"Quench believes in cultivating and fostering its student’s curiosities, as well as establishing local partnerships and enriching the Art's District as an active member of the art community."
I'm please to announce that I will be teaching a cold connection workshop at the Quench Jewelry Arts. Thank you Sarah Sitarz, I am super excited to see what y'all are up to at Quench. 
Scroll Down For More Added Stops!!!

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Case Of The Nomads : Roaming to Unite Radness

HI! I'm Casey. It's very nice to meet you...a little about me? Well, I'm a jewelry artist/metalsmith, mountain biker, freelance writer, adventure seeker and community gatherer.  I'm originally from good 'ol Nebraska but currently I'm an angeleno transplant.

Case of the Nomads is a year long US tour to connect communities. The tour will start this summer and I will be traveling to different cities/towns that are involved in (but not limited to) bikes, art and writing. I will be connecting with others and getting involved, hands on. By keeping a blog post about my adventures, travels and communities I'll be able to connect and share with others around the world. Community is the heart and soul of this project. I feel it's how we learn, support each other and thrive. 

"Tell me and I forget, Teach me and I remember, Involve me and I learn." 

It's important that I support myself while I'm on the road. I plan to write, teach jewelry workshops and have jewelry trunk shows along my route. The fall back plan is to rely on my bartending skills, nothing like working your way across the US one classic cocktail at a time. 

Give Back:

Volunteering

My give back to these amazing communities is volunteering. If you look at my list of stops the ones I will be volunteering will be marks. 

Community Exchange

Are you connected with a craft community? What are your ideas on how to better connect your current community? How has your community influenced your work? Your career? Your life?  Let's sit and have a round table discussion. I want to give you my insight. And I'd love to hear yours.There is no fee for the exchange and will take place at the following stops, for now.

  • Seattle
  • Minneapolis
  • Asheville
  • Denton

Project Goals:

  • Live on the road for 1 year 
  • Create a portable live/studio space
  • Connect Communities : artists, art schools/centers, galleries, bikers, bike events/shops/centers/camps, writers/publishers and many many more!
  • Give Back by Volunteering at bike events, art centers and others
  • Ride in all 49 States (Hawaii would be rad, right?)*Due to scheduling conflicts Alaska is off the route for now but may change*
  • Compete in my first DH race, Thanks to Amanda Batty's #Proving Possible
  • Weekly blog posts with updates and adventures
  • Finish writing first jewelry design book....yes from the road!!!
  • Leave as little trail behind as possible

Where does the money go??

I will be converting a trailer into a live/work space while on the road. I will tow it  behind my car (Scion xB). It needs to be light weight, 1200 lbs or less, and as environmentally friendly as possible. Here's a break down of some of the initial costs:

-Clean Waste Portable Composting Toilet & Bags ($150-$400)

-BioLite Camp Stove & Lights (no fuel needed only sticks or twigs) (www.biolitestove.com) ($450)

-Solar Kit (www.goalzero.com) ($600)

-Used Travel Trailer ($4000-$7000)

-Renovation of trailer into live/work space ($1000-$2000)

-Other initial expenses: trailer reg, material fees, gas, food, etc. ($1000-$2000)

Ideal trailer is a used Scamp 13ft travel trailer USA made in Minnesota

$$ = Supplies & Supplies = Rewards

Here are a list of items I need with a list of rewards in turn for the items. Please contact me to trade!! All items must be new and in great working condition. Items will be added to the list so please check back. Thank You!

(The companies and products listed are companies that I have like minded values with, if you have others to share instead please let me know!)

-BioLite NanoGrid REWARDs: 2 COTN Bandanas, 5 COTN Stickers, 1 postcard from the road

-BioLite CampStove Bundle REWARDs: 2 COTN Bandanas, 10 COTN Stickers, 3 postcards from the road

-Cleanwaste Composting Travel Toilet REWARDs: 2 COTN Bandanas, 5 COTN Stickers, 1 postcard from the road

-Cleanwaste Composting Toilet Bags REWARDs: 2 COTN Bandanas, 10 COTN Stickers, 3 postcards from the road

-Big Agnes Whisky Park O Sleeping Bag: 2 COTN Bandanas, 10 COTN Stickers, 3 postcards from the road

-Big Agnes Rabbit Ears 4 Tent: 2 COTN Bandanas, 10 COTN Stickers, 3 postcards from the road

What if I raise funds past my goal???

If I go over my goal of $10,000 the extra money will go towards the trip. I have put together a budget for the year. With insurance (health/auto/trailer), food, gas, camp ground fees, and other travel expenses plus the initial start up cost my total expenses will be $50,000 (for the year).

Route:

This is a rough outline and could change!!

First Part
US Tour | My new trip on Roadtrippers.com!

Second Part
Second Half US tour | My new trip on Roadtrippers.com!
****Due to schedule conflicts Alaska is off the route, for now. I'll keep you posted****

Unique Rewards

$20 "Stick to Being RAD"

Sport your support with this "Case of the Nomads" black and white vinyl sticker.       Size: 8.50" x 1.38"


$40 "Banded By Rad"

Custom "Case of the Nomads" screen printed bandana (Thanks to Screen Ink for your made screen printing skillz) Size: 20" x 20"


$55 "Road Rad for Jewelers"

I'm sure to find some really cool stuff along the road and on my travels. When I see something that I think could be fashion into some rad jewelry I'll send it to you for your support. You can tell all your friends that you helped another jewelry chase her dream AND you ended up with something fun to create a unique piece of art with a fun adventurous story. 

$300 "Radass" Reward

Signed, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.


$300 "From Rad and Back" Reward

Signed, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.


$300 "Get Rad" Reward

Signed, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.

$500 "tRADing Goods" Reward

Your support will help create a portable studio and I'll trade that support for a one of a kind cuff or belt buckle that I will make while on the road. Check out my work on my etsy shop Casey Sheppard Designs.

Added Stops!!!!!

-Winnie Kao Special Leads @ Seth Godin and Founder of Lessons Learned NYC

-Querencia Community Bike Shop Denton Texas 
-NC Black Mt Airy North Carolina
-Josie Smith @ Decorah Bicycles in Decorah Iowa
-Hsiang-Lynn Pai New York City
-SNAG President & Associate Professor at GVSU Allendale Michigan
-Pocosin Arts Columbia North Carolina
-Melle Finelli Studio Boston Massachusett
-University of North Texas Denton Texas

-Lauren Gregg Santa Cruz California

-Mio Studio Lancaster Pennsylvania 

-Sam Shaw Contemporary Jewelry Northeast Harbor Maine

-24 Hours in the Old Pueblo Tucson Arizona *V*

-Kalmbach Publising Waukesha Wisconsin

-SNAG Executive Director Asheville North Carolina

-EC Design Minneapolis Minneasota

-Sweetlines Gravity Girls Camp Seattle Washington *V*

-Crafthaus Chicago Illinois

-Crankworx Whistler BC *V*

*V* --- Volunteering at these stops

For more details check out Case Of The Nomads

Risks & Challenges

Supporting myself

Supporting myself on the road is one of the biggest challenges with this project. I will be keeping my conservative financial lifestyle and working were I can.

Here is my current and growing list of possible incomes and tools to help chip away at this challenge:

Tenacity: I am always up for a great challenge and adventure.  For more info check out my LinkedIn Profile.

  • Writing first book on jewelry design out in 2017 Published through Kalmbach Books
  • Raised over $3k in 7 weeks for AIDS LifeCycle
  • Road 545 miles on my Surly MTB from San Fran to LA for AIDS Lifecycle
  • Finished AZSS 2015, 40 mile single speed mtb race (took me 11 hours)
  • Showed Jewelry at Top Art Festivals: Cherry Creek, CraftBoston
  • Moved to LA less than 2 years ago and work in top restaurant Bestia

Freelance Writing: I currently write for Art Jewelry Magazine and plan to pick up more publications in the art, travel and bike communities. I want to share my creations, experiences and trails on this grand journey of the road.  Just another way to bring communities together. I will also be writing my first jewelry design book while on the road, I'm gonna be sharing my secrets with y'all.

Work Shops: I'm putting together a jewelry workshop for art centers around the nation. Great way to gather, create and get inspired by each other.

Trunk Shows: The list of venues is small but growing. I plan to have shows at galleries, art centers, private homes and from my travel trailer.

Sponsorships/Brand Ambassadors:  Taking items from my every day life to create a partnership to help expose a company and/or their products on my website, blog and other publications: Jewelry Tools, Bikes, Dog Food, Camping, Environmental, Gluten Free & Health Food and other companies. 

Bartending: Having taken part in the Julian Cox Bar Program and with the guidance of the fierce bar crew at Bestia I have gathered the skills and knowledge of craft cocktails that can provide financial help while on the road. Plus this will connect me with my newest mad creative community.

Safety

Even though I will have India's protection I will still be traveling on my own, exposed to nature and cyber stalkers while living on the road for a year. I'm taking every precaution to prevent the possibility of being in a dangerous or unsafe situation. And will absolutely be carrying bear spray!

Other Ways You Can Help

Make Some Noise by spreading the word and letting others know about my project!! Share my video on your facebook, twitter, instagram and other social medias. The Ingiegogo share tools make this super easy and convenient. Now you can help me connect with YOUR communities.


THANK YOU!!!!!

Photo Opps

(And Yes, my hair changes...a lot!)

Back of the Pack Racing Crew showing me the sights and the way to the finish of Single Speed Arizona 2015

Backing the best bartenders in LA at Bestia

India and Skidmark are ready to roll...bikes and dogs, dogs and bikes

"Navigating the SNAG Circus"
by Casey Sheppard (me) in the March 2015 Art Jewelry Magazine

AIDS LifeCycle finish, 545 miles, 7 days, $3k+ fundraised to help fight AIDS Plus some awesome bright and killer outfits

When you are on the road you create families with the raddest of people
4th of July art festival family cookout

From 90's Club Kid themed Fundraiser Event where I tended Bar as Tank Girl(ish)

Interview at the Cherry Creek Art Festival by the news...rad!

Nothing brings community together better than a snow day, chili and a quick tandem ride for supplies, luv Nebraska winter riding!

Speed Trials during Julian Cox Bar Program training, super serious face!!!

India and me riding one of our favorite bike trails Wilderness

-Big Agnes Rabbit Ears 4 Tent: 2 COTN Bandanas, 10 COTN Stickers, 3 postcards from the road

What if I raise funds past my goal???If I go over my goal of $10,000 the extra money will go towards the trip. I have put together a budget for the year. With insurance (health/auto/trailer), food, gas, camp ground fees, and other travel expenses plus the initial start up cost my total expenses will be $50,000 (for the year). Route:
This is a rough outline and could change!!

US Tour | My new trip on Roadtrippers.com!

Second Part
Second Half US tour | My new trip on Roadtrippers.com!


****Due to schedule conflicts Alaska is off the route, for now. I'll keep you posted****

I'm sure to find some really cool stuff along the road and on my travels. When I see something that I think could be fashion into some rad jewelry I'll send it to you for your support. You can tell all your friends that you helped another jewelry chase her dream AND you ended up with something fun to create a unique piece of art with a fun adventurous story. $300 "Radass" RewardSigned, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.$300 "From Rad and Back" Reward
Signed, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.$300 "Get Rad" RewardSigned, mounted and framed cut out from stop motion video.$500 "tRADing Goods" Reward

I will be keeping my conservative financial lifestyle and working were I can. Here is my current and growing list of possible incomes and tools to help chip away at this challenge:Tenacity: I am always up for a great challenge and adventure.  For more info check out my LinkedIn Profile.
Writing first book on jewelry design out in 2017 Published through Kalmbach Books

Raised over $3k in 7 weeks for AIDS LifeCycle

Road 545 miles on my Surly MTB from San Fran to LA for AIDS Lifecycle

Finished AZSS 2015, 40 mile single speed mtb race (took me 11 hours)
Showed Jewelry at Top Art Festivals: Cherry Creek, CraftBoston

Moved to LA less than 2 years ago and work in top restaurant Bestia

Freelance Writing: I currently write for Art Jewelry Magazine and plan to pick up more publications in the art, travel and bike communities. I want to share my creations, experiences and trails on this grand journey of the road.  Just another way to bring communities together. I will also be writing my first jewelry design book while on the road, I'm gonna be sharing my secrets with y'all. Work Shops: I'm putting together a jewelry workshop for art centers around the nation. Great way to gather, create and get inspired by each other.Trunk Shows: The list of venues is small but growing. I plan to have shows at galleries, art centers, private homes and from my travel trailer. Sponsorships/Brand Ambassadors:  Taking items from my every day life to create a partnership to help expose a company and/or their products on my website, blog and other publications: Jewelry Tools, Bikes, Dog Food, Camping, Environmental, Gluten Free & Health Food and other companies. Bartending: Having taken part in the Julian Cox Bar Program and with the guidance of the fierce bar crew at Bestia I have gathered the skills and knowledge of craft cocktails that can provide financial help while on the road. Plus this will connect me with my newest mad creative community. SafetyEven though I will have India's protection I will still be traveling on my own, exposed to nature and cyber stalkers while living on the road for a year. I'm taking every precaution to prevent the possibility of being in a dangerous or unsafe situation. And will absolutely be carrying bear spray!  Other Ways You Can HelpMake Some Noise by spreading the word and letting others know about my project!! Share my video on your facebook, twitter, instagram and other social medias. The Ingiegogo share tools make this super easy and convenient. Now you can help me connect with YOUR communities. THANK YOU!!!!!Photo Opps(And Yes, my hair changes...a lot!)Back of the Pack Racing Crew showing me the sights and the way to the finish of Single Speed Arizona 2015Backing the best bartenders in LA at BestiaIndia and Skidmark are ready to roll...bikes and dogs, dogs and bikes"Navigating the SNAG Circus" by Casey Sheppard (me) in the March 2015 Art Jewelry MagazineAIDS LifeCycle finish, 545 miles, 7 days, $3k+ fundraised to help fight AIDS Plus some awesome bright and killer outfitsWhen you are on the road you create families with the raddest of people4th of July art festival family cookout From 90's Club Kid themed Fundraiser Event where I tended Bar as Tank Girl(ish)Interview at the Cherry Creek Art Festival by the news...rad!Nothing brings community together better than a snow day, chili and a quick tandem ride for supplies, luv Nebraska winter riding!Speed Trials during Julian Cox Bar Program training, super serious face!!!India and me riding one of our favorite bike trails Wilderness

story:
English

Italiano

Français



TAKABUM.

 

Why music

Music is an important component for the full growth of the individual and organic.

Studying music since childhood allows the child to develop his creative and communicative potential at best and, fun, to assimilate in a short time a method that will help him overcome the difficulties related to the concentration and the music studio. Music, through play, gives the child the tools to enter into a relationship with the environment and the people around him.

Making music together creates a new shared space in the family : adults, with the child, enter the game and together they experience the infinite possibilities that the voice and sounds (even of small objects) offer.

The music strengthens the bonds and gives a whole new color to the time spent together.

The music helps the child:

    • to develop the potential of hearing
    • to learn listening to himself and others
    • in attention and concentration
    • to express themselves with their body
    • giving tools to unleash the imagination and creativity, develop their imagination and creativity

 

Method

The child is accompanied by listening through a method that follows strict guidelines approved by pediatricians. The main tools we use in our musical sequences are "child-proof", that leverage the solicitation of some skills that the child is called to stake, thanks to the direct reaction of listening.

At the same time the child is accompanied by the adult to perform simple gestures easy and repetitive that allow him to create new mental associations and help coordination and body awareness.

In particular, our method is based on some basic and useful tools:

  • The babbling: is the creation of a sound language from syllables that are tuned to particular tunes, easily remembered and expressive.
  • imitation: the child, listening, feels emotionally involved and is brought to play with his own personal alphabet sound that has internalized.
  • The same or different? The repetition and variation: the adult is called to associate with certain sounds of the precise movements of the body (and for total) that the child, curious, will try to reproduce in his own way. The repetition of these gestures, along with gradual changes, allow the child and the adult interaction whole new, learning at the same time, the basic concepts of music.
  • Hold time!the pace: along with the melodies, the cd offers clear examples of rhythmic sequences. The development of the sense of rhythm allows the child to improve quality as the coordination and self-awareness.
  • SSSht!..silence: the alternation of music and silence, opens space for the child to externalize the first and immediate reactions that arise from listening and from contact with the adult who guides him.

 

Goals

These funds will be used to make use of the following professional:

– composer, voices, for the music album;
– developer, to create the app Takabum in the three main store (Ios, Android, Windows Phone);
– educationalist, for the production of the content and the search of the phonemes;
– designer, for the graphics and presentation of the pamphlet;
– blogs, for the management of social;
– printer, for making paper limited edition.



TAKABUM.

 

Perchè la musica

La musica é un’importante componente per la crescita completa e organica dell’individuo.

Studiare musica sin da piccolo permette al bambino di sviluppare le sue potenzialità comunicative e creative al meglio e, divertendosi, di assimilare in breve tempo un metodo che lo aiuterà a superare le difficoltà legate alla concentrazione e allo studio.La musica, attraverso il gioco, dona al bambino gli strumenti per entrare in relazione con l’ambiente e le persone che lo circondano.

Fare musica insieme crea un nuovo spazio di condivisione in famiglia : l’adulto, con il bambino, si mette in gioco e insieme sperimentano le infinite possibilità che la voce e i suoni (anche solo di piccoli oggetti) offrono.

La musica rafforza i legami e dà un colore tutto nuovo al tempo passato insieme.

La musica aiuta il bambino:

    • a sviluppare le potenzialità dell’udito
    • a imparare l’ascolto di se stesso e degli altri
    • nell’attenzione e nella concentrazione
    • a esprimersi con il proprio corpo
    • dando strumenti per liberare l’immaginazione e la creatività, sviluppa la propria immaginazione e creatività

 

Metodo

Il bambino viene accompagnato nell’ascolto grazie a un metodo che segue precise direttive approvate dai pediatri. Gli strumenti principali che utilizziamo nelle nostre sequenze musicali sono ” a prova di bambino”, cioè fanno leva sulla sollecitazione di alcune abilità che il bambino é chiamato a mettere in gioco, grazie alla reazione dell’ascolto diretto.

Contemporaneamente il bambino é accompagnato dall’adulto a compiere semplici gesti facili e ripetitivi che gli permettono di creare nuove associazioni mentali e aiutano il coordinamento e la consapevolezza del proprio corpo.

In particolare, il nostro metodo si fonda su alcuni utili e basilari strumenti:

  • La lallazione: consiste nella creazione di un linguaggio sonoro a partire da sillabe che vengono intonate su particolari melodie, facilmente memorizzabili e espressive.
  • l’imitazione: il bambino, ascoltando, si sente coinvolto emotivamente ed è portato a riprodurre con un suo personale alfabeto sonoro quello che ha interiorizzato.
  • Uguali o diversi? La ripetizione e la variazione: l’adulto è chiamato a associare a determinati suoni dei precisi movimenti del corpo (o del viso) che il bambino, curioso, cercherà di riprodurre a suo modo. La ripetizione di questi gesti, insieme a graduali variazioni, permetterà al bambino e all’adulto un’interazione tutta nuova, apprendendo allo stesso tempo, i concetti base della musica.
  • Tieni il tempo!il ritmo: insieme alle melodie, il cd propone chiari esempi di sequenze ritmiche. Lo sviluppo del senso del ritmo permette al bambino di accrescere qualità come la coordinazione e la consapevolezza di sé.
  • SSSht!..il silenzio: grazie all’alternanza di musica e silenzi, si apre lo spazio per il bambino per esternare le prime e immediate reazioni che nascono dall’ascolto e dal contatto con l’adulto che lo guida.

 

Obiettivi

Questi fondi verranno usati per avvalerci delle seguenti professionalità:

– compositore, voci, per le musiche dell’album;
– sviluppatore, per creare l’app Takabum nei tre principali store (Ios, Android, Windows Phone);
– pedagogista, per la produzione dei contenuti e la ricerca dei fonemi;
– disegnatore, per le grafiche e il pamphlet di presentazione;
– blogger, per la gestione dei social;
– stampatore, per la realizzazione cartacea dell’edizione limitata.



TAKABUM.


Parce que la musique

La musique est un élément important pour la croissance intégrale de la personne et biologique.

Étudier la musique depuis l'enfance permet à l'enfant de développer son potentiel créatif et communicatif au mieux, et, amusement, à assimiler en peu de temps une méthode qui va l'aider à surmonter les difficultés liées à la concentration et la musique studio.La, par le jeu, donne à l'enfant les outils pour entrer en relation avec l'environnement et les gens autour de lui.

Faire de la musique ensemble crée un nouvel espace partagé dans la famille : l'adulte, avec l'enfant, entre dans le jeu et, ensemble, ils éprouvent les possibilités infinies que la voix et les sons (même de petits objets) offre.

La musique renforce les liens et donne une toute nouvelle couleur pour le temps passé ensemble.

La musique aide l'enfant:

    • de développer le potentiel de l'audition
    • à apprendre l'écoute de soi et des autres
    • de l'attention et la concentration
    • de se exprimer avec leur corps
    • donnant des outils pour libérer l'imagination et la créativité, développer leur imagination et la créativité

Méthode

L'enfant est accompagné par l'écoute grâce à une méthode qui suit des directives strictes approuvées par les pédiatres. Les principaux outils que nous utilisons dans nos séquences musicales sont "l'épreuve des enfants", qui exploitent la sollicitation de certaines compétences que l'enfant est appelé à participation, grâce à la réaction directe de l'écoute.

Dans le même temps l'enfant est accompagné par l'adulte pour effectuer des gestes simples facile et répétitif qui lui permettent de créer de nouvelles associations mentales et la coordination de l'aide et la conscience du corps.

En particulier, notre méthode est basée sur quelques outils de base et utiles:

  • Le babillage: est la création d'un langage sonore de syllabes qui sont à l'écoute des airs particuliers, facile à retenir et expressif.
  • imitation: l'enfant, écoute, se sent émotionnellement impliqué et est amené à jouer avec son propre son alphabet personnels qui ont intériorisé.
  • Identiques ou différents,? Le répétition et la variation: l'adulte est appelé à se associer avec certains sons des mouvements précis du corps (et pour le total) que l'enfant, curieux, va essayer de reproduire à sa manière. La répétition de ces gestes, ainsi que des changements graduels, permettre à l'enfant et de l'interaction des adultes tout nouveau, apprendre en même temps, les concepts de base de la musique.
  • Temps de maintien!le rythme: avec les mélodies, le cd propose des exemples clairs de séquences rythmiques. Le développement du sens du rythme permet à l'enfant d'améliorer la qualité que de la coordination et de la conscience de soi.
  • SSSht!..silence: l'alternance de la musique et le silence, ouvre un espace pour l'enfant à externaliser les premières réactions et immédiats qui résultent de l'écoute et du contact avec l'adulte qui le guide.

Objectifs

Ces fonds seront utilisés pour faire usage de la professionnelle suivante:

– compositeur, voix, pour l'album de musique;
– promoteur, pour créer l'application Takabum dans les trois magasin principal (Ios, Androïde, Windows Phone);
– éducateur, pour la production du contenu et de la recherche de phonèmes;
– designer, pour les graphiques et la présentation de la brochure;
– blogs, pour la gestion de sociale;
– imprimeur, pour fabriquer du papier édition limitée.

story:
Short Summary

What many of us often forget is that when missionaries serve abroad, their children serve too! They are a vital part to a successful missionary team and a healthy family. 

I have the opportunity to direct a youth retreat for missionary students living in West Africa while their parents attend a retreat hosted by World Venture.

  • I am passionate about spending time with Jr. and Sr. high school students and sharing Biblical truths that apply to their daily life.
  • Retreats are a great way to emotionally decompress and provide encouragement to students.
  • Many of these students live in countries that are 95% Muslim.

I am extremely excited to travel to Senegal to encourage these students as well as be impacted myself by the work that is being done in this region.

What I Need & What You Get

I need $500 to offset the travel costs to get to Senegal. You will receive a digital photograph or professional print of your choosing from the trip:

  • Although this trip is not about photography, it is almost impossible for me to travel and not bring a camera. This Indiegogo campaign is to help fund my travel expenses for this retreat in Senegal.
  • The total cost of the flight and Visa is $1300 per person. However, many gracious people from my sending church (Asbury Community Chapel) have provided financial gifts to contribute to the trip, totaling $800 per person. So that leaves me with a $500 difference.
  • What you will get is either a digital photograph to use as a desktop wallpaper or a professional print for your enjoyment or as a reminder to pray for the missionaries working in West Africa. Click on the "Perks" section for more details!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Pray for our team. We would appreciate your prayers and encourage you to not just pray for us, but the missionaries who will attend the conference as well.
  • Share this campaign and encourage others to pray as well.

their children serve too! They are a vital part to a successful 
missionary team and a healthy family.

Retreats are a great way to emotionally decompress and provide encouragement to students.

Many of these students live in countries that are 95% Muslim.

 I am extremely excited to travel to Senegal to encourage these students as well as be impacted myself by the work that is being done in this region.   What I Need & What You Get I need $500 to offset the travel costs to get to Senegal. You will receive a digital photograph or professional print of your choosing from the trip:  Although this trip is not about photography, it is almost impossible for
 me to travel and not bring a camera. This Indiegogo campaign is to 
help fund my travel expenses for this retreat in Senegal.

The total cost of the flight and Visa is $1300 per person. However, many gracious people from my sending church (Asbury Community Chapel) have provided financial gifts to contribute to the trip, totaling $800 per person. So that leaves me with a $500 difference.
 What you will get is either a digital photograph to use as a desktop wallpaper or a professional print for your enjoyment or as a reminder to pray for the missionaries working in West Africa. Click on the "Perks" section for more details!

   Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Pray for our team. We would appreciate your prayers and encourage you to not just pray for us, but the missionaries who will attend the conference as well.
 Share this campaign and encourage others to pray as well.

story:
For english version, click here.

 

Une démarche participative pour sauver l’hôtel Club 3 îlets…

Notre appel au financement participatif est destiné à donner du futur à une entreprise qui se bat dans des conditions inégales. L’enjeu est sa sauvegarde en résistant à la crise du tourisme sur cette destination et en procédant à une rupture avec le modèle économique dominant. Il consiste également à sauver …

…un trésor sur une plage des Caraïbes…

À deux pas de l’unique Golf de la Martinique, cet ensemble immobilier de 77 chambres abrite une cour privée et le plus beau jardin-tropical du Sud de l’île. Au fil de son histoire, cet établissement hôtelier a accompagné la transformation en douceur d’un quartier traditionnel de pêcheur, l’Anse à l’Âne, de la commune des Trois Ilets. Il a très largement contribué à l’essor de ce quartier qui est devenu un pôle résidentiel et d’attractivité touristiques. Il a permis, grâce à son dynamisme, la création et le maintien de l’emploi direct et indirect, permanent et saisonnier au sein d’une ancienne petite communauté rurale et fragile qui a su garder son authenticité. Avec le temps, l’hôtel est devenu une référence incontournable autant pour les habitants et commerçants du quartier que pour les professionnels du tourisme qui tombent amoureux de ce site exceptionnel.

..un projet original

Nous avons le projet de rénover cet hôtel de charme en life-style hôtel pour en faire un établissement qui  tente de répondre aux besoins des consommateurs en matière d’innovation et de personnalisation en misant sur la convivialité, sur une cuisine authentique, sur l’accessibilité de la technologie, sur l’émotion et sur la polyvalence. En fait, on souhaite que le client y reconnaisse son propre style de vie…

Le produit actuel se transformera en « Life style-Hôtel 4 étoiles » et proposera une nouvelle offre touristique consacrée à l’Art et à la musique de notre région avec tous les services essentiels pour en faire une expérience mémorable accessible non seulement aux « visiteurs de l’Art » mais aussi au plus grand nombre.

Ce Life-style Hôtel développera de nouvelles activités autour de la pratique du Golf, d’un atelier gastronomique (restaurant d’application de la gastronomie créole), d’atelier d’artistes et de loisirs nautiques.

La rénovation se fera en deux phases : la première est une phase de transition et de remise à niveau qui vise à réduire les handicaps, à consolider les améliorations et à préparer le changement ; elle correspond aux travaux réalisés au cours d’une fermeture partielle en octobre et novembre 2015.

La seconde phase, de juin à novembre 2016 correspond aux travaux de grosse rénovation et à l’intervention finale des artistes.

Pourquoi faisons-nous appel à vous?

Cette entreprise  a déjà une valeur d’usage inestimable pour ses fidèles clients. Elle est une valeur financière sure pour des investisseurs et elle a une valeur économique pour la destination Martinique. Pourtant, l’hôtel Club 3 îlets est une entreprise en difficulté et la poursuite de son activité est aujourd’hui menacée après trente mois de procédure collective.

Aussi face au risque de fermeture, le personnel de l’hôtel Club 3 Ilets vous demande de bien vouloir témoigner et agir ; il sollicite votre soutien et un financement participatif pour que cet écrin soit protégé et reste encore pendant de nombreuses saisons un outil incontournable du tourisme de la Martinique. Aux côtés du personnel, nous actionnaires de la société de l’hôtel Club 3 îlets, nous avons fait le choix  de relancer l’entreprise par un plan de continuation afin d’éviter la vente à la casse ou « à la découpe » de ce patrimoine immobilier touristique unique et exceptionnel.

La «campagne de financement participatif »que l’hôtel souhaite organiser est donc l’occasion pour certains de manifester leur attachement à cet établissement ou/et, pour d’autres, de partager les aspirations de rénovation faute de quoi la poursuite d’exploitation ne sera pas possible. Nous recherchons la somme de 1.130.000€ pour avoir les moyens complémentaires de rénover notre modèle économique et crée un produit qui permettent de lisser le risque de saisonnalité. Une action qui permet de protéger ce trésor des caraïbes et qui permettra de sauver 30 emplois en offrant un nouvel élan à l’hôtel.

Qu’est ce que nous vous avons réservé ?

L'objectif de ce projet est multiple.

Il est de mobiliser une communauté pour sauver son patrimoine et un outil de travail. Il est de vous offrir en contrepartie de vos dons ou contributions, la participation à une aventure saine et motivante, le respect de nos engagements et la réalisation d’un projet original.

Il est enfin d'offrir aux investisseurs une opportunité originale en leur fournissant comme support des produits permettant la transformation d’un hôtel 3* en une résidence de distinction gérée par des professionnels expérimentés de l'hôtellerie. Mais dans ce cadre, ce n'est pas seulement un investissement, c'est un mode de vie.

En premier lieu, votre contribution va permettre grâce également au concours des chefs de cuisine et pâtissiers, membres de l’Académie Nationale de cuisine française,  de former, réinsérer, offrir des débouchés, pour relancer l’emploi des jeunes en Martinique, et assurer la transmission du savoir-faire français et caraïbes. Il s’agit de combler les nombreux emplois qui restent non-pourvus dans le secteur difficile de la restauration. La recette est d’utiliser le temps disponible pendant la basse saison en réalisant 5 sessions de 8 à 10 personnes composées d’une formation gratuite de 8 semaines, suivie de 4 semaines de stage.

Des manifestations telles que déjeuners et dîners de gala seront organisés à l’occasion de l’ouverture de saison 2015-2016, elles pourront accueillir jusqu’à 150 couverts à chaque fois.

Votre contribution nous donnera les moyens de faire une campagne pour restaurer l’hôtel grâce à la participation des artistes et designers de la Caraïbes et du monde entier. Ce type de contribution offre une opportunité d’investissement qui permet à la fois un coup de cœur et le droit à une déduction fiscale. Ainsi, si un contributeur décide de mettre 2500€ sur le projet de traitement artistique d’une chambre (outre l’invitation à un dîner privé à l’hôtel en présence des artistes et à la visite privilégiée des chambres décorées par les artistes), le montant retomberait aux alentours de 850€ après déduction fiscale. Cette offre est donc une vraie incentive supplémentaire pour aider le projet de rénovation.

Nous préparons une saison exceptionnelle de soirées privées  « show case » dans les salons fermés, en plein air ou sur la plage de l’hôtel vous permettant de découvrir de manière privilégiée une sélection d’artistes de blues et de jazz  invités aux différents festivals de la caraïbe du moment (Festival de Jazz de St Lucie, Blue Festival de Marie-Galante, Créole Festival de la Dominique, Barbados Reggae Festival, Lamentin Jazz Project…).

Et bien sur, nous proposons aux supporteurs de notre hôtel et à nos premiers «visiteurs de l’Art » des séjours et des produits dérivés à des tarifs exceptionnels.

Devenez membre du Club Art Project !

L’hôtel souhaite réunir ses fidèles clients et supporteurs dans une structure ad hoc   - le Club Art Project - qui est une véritable ouverture sur le monde de l’Art et de la musique des caraïbes. En offrant des avantages particuliers de type accès VIP selon certaines conditions aux membres du Club Art Project, l’idée est de tisser une relation durable avec nos clients. C’est aussi de conserver le plus longtemps possible l’authenticité du quartier de l’Anse à l’Âne ainsi que la qualité du vivre ensemble en s’appuyant sur les échanges et l’évènementiel que l’hôtel Club 3 îlets va entreprendre.

Le défi à relever !

De nombreux clients et amoureux de l’hôtel Club 3 îlets se sont mobilisés à travers une pétition pour dire non à la fermeture de cet établissement, et nous en sommes reconnaissants. Les signataires de la pétition sont d’ores et déjà enregistrés comme premiers membres d’honneur du Club Art Project.  Ils bénéficient  d’un accès VIP à toutes les manifestations de l’hôtel et le management leur offre un séjour de 5 jours gratuit sur la saison 2016 (janvier à mars). En contrepartie, nous attendons que chacun fasse prospérer la campagne de financement participatif en diffusant nos informations au plus grand nombre. La diffusion efficace permettra éventuellement de mobiliser des investisseurs institutionnels.

En effet, la société Hôtel Club 3 îlets est une entreprise en difficulté qui ne peut pas bénéficier de financement bancaire. Les actionnaires ont déjà beaucoup investis et ne pourront remettre plus d’1.000.000 €. Pour aider l’entreprise et lui permettre d’avoir un avenir durable grâce à un projet le repositionnant  sur une voie plus viable, la campagne compte déjà sur un parrainage et un soutien exceptionnel  des acteurs de l’Art et de la Musique et du Tourisme. Elle doit aussi rassembler au moins 1.130.000 € pour la réussite du projet.

Le délai de souscription prévu est du 28 Août 2015 au 23 septembre 2015.Tout souscripteur ou participant devient membre de plein droit du Club Art Project.

Les sommes seront versées sur compte séquestre et conservées jusqu’à la notification du jugement de la Cour d’Appel prévue le 29 septembre. Si, à cette date, la période de redressement est converti en liquidation  les sommes seront restituées aux souscripteurs. Si la décision est favorable à la poursuite d’exploitation, une « Newsletter » vous tiendra régulièrement informé de l’opération « sauvetage », du suivi des travaux et des conditions de la relance de l’établissement ainsi que du programme des évènements de la prochaine saison.

Pas convaincu ? 
On vous explique pourquoi il faut sauver l'Hôtel Club 3 Ilêts...

story: piazzAcolori nasce dall' idea dell'associazione Anzichitanza. É un movimento che nasce dal basso, da comuni cittadini che desiderano, mediante la creatività e l'arte, riappropiarsi di spazi comuni spesso dimenticati o destinati ad usi diversi. Questo progetto nasce nel cuore della Sicilia, a Caltanissetta, in un sud spesso in ginocchio e "sofferente". Questo é una parte di Sicilia che vuole rialzarsi e lottare per la propria città, con l'intento di vederla viva e pulsante. piazzAcolori é questo e vuole essere molto altro, vuole essere un lavoro continuo in cui azioni a scopo sociale e di riappropriazione si susseguono, abbracciando l'intera città!
story_txt:
piazzAcolori nasce dall' idea dell'associazione
Anzichitanza. É un movimento che nasce dal basso, da comuni cittadini che
desiderano, mediante la creatività e l'arte, riappropiarsi di spazi comuni
spesso dimenticati o destinati ad usi diversi. Questo progetto nasce nel cuore
della Sicilia, a Caltanissetta, in un sud spesso in ginocchio e
"sofferente". Questo é una parte di Sicilia che vuole rialzarsi e
lottare per la propria città, con l'intento di vederla viva e pulsante. piazzAcolori
é questo e vuole essere molto altro, vuole essere un lavoro continuo in cui
azioni a scopo sociale e di riappropriazione si susseguono, abbracciando
l'intera città!

story:
TIDES OF RESILIENCE

A photography and multimedia exhibition about climate change upon Bangladesh

Thank you to those who have funded this exhibition project so far.  The results are:



In the exhibition ‘Tides of Resilience’ I continue to explore how climate change is affecting communities around the word, this time in Bangladesh. 

The exhibition has been gaining a bit of media exposure: 

  • The Age
  • The Big Issue and Leader

The exhibition is raising money to cover its costs and to donate to a charity that builds schools and provides education in Bangladesh.  “I began this project to bring the story of these people to the attention of a wider audience, and in doing so give something back to them.”  Ten percent of sales and money raised towards the exhibition will be donated to the charity Co-Operation In Development.  You can make a contribution to the project by visiting FUND.


“This is very strong work. It is work that should be seen by the widest audience possible. It addresses not only the crucial elements of climate change and the way it affects people’s lives, but the over-riding theme is human resilience, dignity and self-respect.” Ms Julie Millowick, President of MAP Group.


This exhibition is proudly sponsored by the Climate Advocacy Fund, engaging with companies for improved climate performance www.climateadvocacyfund.com.au and Pixel Perfect www.pixelperfect.com.au for all your professional printing needs. Many other sponsors have kindly donated their products or services, see below. 


Obscura Gallery

Exhibition dates: 24 Oct – 18 Nov

First Floor, 285 Carlisle Street

East St Kilda, 3183
Melbourne, Australia
ph: +61 409 312 839
info@obscuragallery.com
Opening Hours 
Tues - Sat: 12pm - 6pm


Rodney holds a Masters degree in Environmental Analysis and International Development, he is represented by Obscura Photos and is a member of MAP Group.

story:
Short Summary

The Galt (Cambridge) Armoury will be 100 years old in 2014. This has been our home for all that time. As members of the HLI, the HF of C and now as the RHFC the armoury has seen thousands of members pass through in peace and war. Even if you were only in the army for a few months this place is a part of you. Commemorate the centennial of a grand old building by donating to the armoury portrait project.

What We Need & What You Get

We have commissioned Cambridge artist, Alex Krajewski, to paint a portrait of the armoury. The image you see is his concept sketch for the project. Mr Krajewski's fee for the Commission is $7,000. Prints of the portrait will be available for sale at his gallery in Cambridge. We will also be selling draw tickets for a framed print of the armoury.

The Impact

This is our chance to put something from this generation of Fusiliers up on the armoury walls. Looking around it's easy to believe that nothing has happened in the that building since 1945. We have been serving Canada in Cyprus, Bosnia and Afghanistan and it's time we acknowledged our own service.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a donation isn't possible buy a draw ticket at the Men's Chritsmas Dinner. Tell your friends
story_txt: Short SummaryThe Galt (Cambridge) Armoury will be 100 years old in 2014. This has been our home for all that time. As members of the HLI, the HF of C and now as the RHFC the armoury has seen thousands of members pass through in peace and war. Even if you were only in the army for a few months this place is a part of you. Commemorate the centennial of a grand old building by donating to the armoury portrait project.What We Need & What You GetWe have commissioned Cambridge artist, Alex Krajewski, to paint a portrait of the armoury. The image you see is his concept sketch for the project. Mr Krajewski's fee for the Commission is $7,000. Prints of the portrait will be available for sale at his gallery in Cambridge. We will also be selling draw tickets for a framed print of the armoury.The ImpactThis is our chance to put something from this generation of Fusiliers up on the armoury walls. We have been serving Canada in Cyprus, Bosnia and Afghanistan and it's time we acknowledged our own service.Other Ways You Can HelpIf a donation isn't possible buy a draw ticket at the Men's Chritsmas Dinner. story:
The Magic Bus Tour

Hello, we are A-peg. An organisation exploring audience participation through experimentation and games. We are looking to raise enough money to fund artist materials for the Magic Bus tour. We've asked five artists to make work in unexplored pastures, and they've accepted.

On the 17th November, Sunday afternoon, the Magic Bus tour begins 12pm Midday. We are travelling via double decker 1960s  Green Bus, with 60 passengers. The tour will travel through South Bristol from Clifton towards Chew Valley Lake and back. Throughout the journey will be several stops in the countryside to visit work by Artists: Hannah Sullivan, Shaun Badham, Alice Duck, Joe Deighan and Vickie Fear. A-peg will be providing lunch and refreshments, as well as some artisan commentary. It is a jam-packed afternoon of merriment, art and culture all set against the beautiful Bristol greenery. 

With your contributions you will be supporting local emerging artists, showcased in an original performative journey. An experience we would love to share with you!

What we need & what you get

We are looking for 1,000 to make sure we can provide the artists with materials and production costs and if all succeeds some money for their work. We also need to fund the bus. We are offering tickets for £13 each Link: https://a-pegmagicbus.eventbrite.co.uk/ with lunch provided, but this will only cover hiring the bus and driver. So to secure our artists we are looking for your help.

If we don't reach the target we will put any money towards artist materials, but the more the better to produce the best we can.

To give you something for your support we have rewards including: personalised pegs, photos of the journey and artworks, and an Italian dinner party with A-peg (cooked by a real Italian woman!).

The Impact

If you love art and would feel good about promoting young talent, this is the project to support us on. We've got a track record of giving people a good time, and working collaboratively on projects. This project will have a positive resounding effect on both the artists and the audience, providing a new experience for a large group of people which we hope will filter onto many more things to come.

story:
Background

After 60 glamorous years entertaining guests on the Las Vegas strip, the Riviera Hotel Casino closed it’s doors forever on May 4th, 2015. The Riv was the first high rise on the strip, signaling a departure from the motor courts that previously welcomed travelers.  The haunts of the Rat Pack have steadily disappeared over the years and the Riviera held on as long as she could. The resort that famously hosted entertainers Liberace, Frank Sinatra and countless others as well as film productions such as Ocean’s Eleven, The Hangover and Casino will soon become another ghost of Fabulous Las Vegas.

In order to keep up with fierce competition from other cities, the Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority (LVCVA) purchased the property to expand their convention capacity and to have a presence on the Las Vegas strip. The closing of the Riviera struck a raw nerve with many who miss the pre-corporate Sin City. Passionate petition drives to save the resort appear to have fallen a bit short. The Riviera will be imploded as early as this summer.

The Project

We cannot save the structures but we can save the most identifiable architectural elements, the neon signs. For the last year we have been working with the LVCVA to arrange for the preservation of two very important signs before the buildings are demolished. With final agreement, we now have the monumental task of removing the signs safely. The funds collected will pay for a bonded, union sign company to remove the iconic red script sign on Las Vegas Boulevard and the bulb and neon sign on the corner of Las Vegas Blvd. and Riviera Blvd (Both featured in photos). Once safely removed, the signs will require trucks for transportation and storage. The signs are massive and we will need to have a crane and bucket truck with crews to properly preserve them. If we are unable to raise adequate funding there is a strong possibility that one or both signs will be destroyed during the demolition! Classic neon signs are disappearing rapidly, the time to preserve them is now.

The Riviera signs will be safely stored until they are installed in a major exhibition that celebrates Nevada’s neon heritage currently under development.

Project Costs

Sign Company- Time and Materials full day with crew, crane and bucket truck -$2,800

Lane Closure Permitting- $200

Transportation- $800

Total- $3,800

Who We Are

For the last 20 years we have been preserving the disappearing neon signage that glorified the Silver State through much of the 20th century. The collection represents the entire state of Nevada from Elko and Reno to Carson City and Las Vegas. The preserved signs come from properties such as: Sahara Las Vegas, Flamingo Las Vegas, Harolds Club Reno, Brandin Iron Elko and scores more. Will Durham, who will oversee this project, has personally preserved more Nevada Neon signs than anyone else in the state. We have extensive experience preserving these historical gems and we will show the Riviera signs all due care and respect.

The signs we have preserved have been exhibited at venues such as: Museum of Neon Art, The Neon Museum, University of Nevada Reno, Western Folklife Center in Elko and were the feature exhibition in 2012-13 at the Nevada Museum of Art. We are currently developing a major neon project to help permanently honor the art and craft that helped forge Nevada’s maverick image.

We Ask for your Assistance

People often lament the loss of iconic structures and the neon signs that represent them without knowing how to get involved. Preservation is very difficult and expensive work. This is an opportunity to participate in a high profile preservation project of an iconic Las Vegas legend. Please help us hang onto a piece of the Riviera magic. Thank you so much for your participation in this exciting preservation project!

story:
Hello Friends!

I've been invited to take part in the Ayatana Artistic Research Program: Biophilia 

http://www.artayatana.com/index.html

A residency focused on the education and enrichment of artists through exposure to nature and scientist-lead workshops. The residency will take place from September 9th–15th. During this week I will work alongside other artists and scientists exploring aspects of our world such as zoology, botany, entomology, and even human tissue research! 

I will need your help covering the cost of the residency to be able to attend this amazing opportunity.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The residency will cost $1500 CAD to attend, and a travel budget of $200 USD.

  • Equipment: If enough funding is gathered, I will be purchasing a Structure Sensor portable 3D scanner to use during the residency. $200-$400 USD

  • I will create a unique piece of work for you! All the pieces will be created using source materials( 3D scans, photographs, audio/video, etc...) collected during the residency. 

The Impact

  • My current work deals heavily with the integration of living beings as well as the duality of natural and synthetic forms. This residency will allow me to further explore my work and expand my understanding of organic life in relation to new media. http://www.adrianerivera.com/

  • I will be able to experiment with new ways to examine and capture organisms in their natural environment as well as a controlled laboratory.

  • I will make use of practices such as 3D Scanning/modeling/printing and sound based deformation to create new work sourced from the residency.

Other Ways You Can Help

The deadline for the residency is fast approaching, and I will need your help spreading this campaign as quickly as possible!
